At the end of the Select Operatives step, select one DOCTRINA IMPERATIVE to be a Primary Mode for your kill team until the end of the battle (note that selecting a Primary Mode doesn’t automatically give you the effects of that DOCTRINA IMPERATIVE for the battle; you must still select it as a STRATEGIC GAMBIT, as below).
STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one DOCTRINA IMPERATIVE for friendly HUNTER CLADE operatives to have until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase. Each DOCTRINA IMPERATIVE has both an Optimisation and a Deprecation rule. Both are in effect while your kill team has that DOCTRINA IMPERATIVE. Once per battle, when you select the DOCTRINA IMPERATIVE that’s your kill team’s Primary Mode, you can ignore its Deprecation rule.
Bulwark Imperative Optimisation changed to read: ‘Normal Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on friendly HUNTER CLADE operatives.’.

name: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHERS
description: Navy Breachers are elite Voidsmen who are outfitted, trained and endlessly drilled in boarding actions and void-based combat. Wielding a wide array of cutting gear, boarding shields and close-range weapons, they are well-suited to deadly combat in close confines.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER SERGEANT-AT-ARMS operative with the following option:
    ○ Navis shotgun and Navis hatchet
  Or one option from each of the following:
    ○ Bolt pistol or heirloom autopistol
    ○ Chainsword or power weapon
↘ 10 IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operatives selected from the following list:
  • ARMSMAN
  • AXEJACK
  • C.A.T. UNIT
  • ENDURANT
  • GHEISTSKULL
  • GRENADIER
  • GUNNER with Navis las-volley and gun butt
  • GUNNER with meltagun and gun butt
  • GUNNER with plasma gun and gun butt
  • HATCHCUTTER
  • SURVEYOR
  • VOID-JAMMER
Other than ARMSMAN operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to two GUNNER operatives.
Your kill team can only include a GHEISTSKULL operative if it also includes a VOID-JAMMER operative, and it can only include a C.A.T. UNIT operative if it also includes a SURVEYOR operative.
These operatives count as half a selection each, meaning you can select both of them and it’s treated as one selection in total.

operatives.name: NAVIS SERGEANT-AT-ARMS
operatives.description: A Tempestor leads their kill team into the thick of battle. More than just a warrior, they also possess the tactical and strategic nous to direct their squad’s efforts. They exhibit a sense of agency and a flair for improvisation that can prove vital during extended operations behind enemy lines.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, LEADER, SERGEANT-AT-ARMS

operatives.name: NAVIS ARMSMAN
operatives.description: Counted amongst the complement of many Navis Imperialis vessels, Navy Breachers are elite Voidsmen who are outfitted, trained and endlessly drilled in boarding actions and void-based combat.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, ARMSMAN

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER ARMSMAN operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule). Ignore this rule when you are using the Breach and Clear faction rule.

operatives.name: NAVIS AXEJACK
operatives.description: Sometimes, the only solution to a problem faced by Imperial Navy Breachers is a heavy, two-handed axe. The Axejacks who carry these weapons can not only smash through blocked doorways obstacles, they are also formidable fighters who hack apart any enemy in their way.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, AXEJACK

abilities.name: Wall Breacher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Fight action against a terrain feature, if it has 1 wound remaining, Critical Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it (to a minimum of 0).

operatives.name: NAVIS C.A.T. UNIT
operatives.description: Cyber-Altered Task Units are tracked reconnaissance vehicles that have served the Imperium for millennia. Fitted with pict-recording equipment and frequency scanning augurs, they can be remotely operated to provide vital tactical information for their kill team.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, C.A.T. UNIT

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules:
• This operative cannot be activated or perform actions if it’s within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER SURVEYOR operative has been incapacitated. The turning point can end even if this operative is still ready.
• This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Reposition and Spot.
• It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight, climb or jump.
• Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
• Whenever this operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

operatives.name: NAVIS ENDURANT
operatives.description: Endurants are the most heavily armoured and resilient operatives in an Imperial Navy Breacher kill team. They can weather devastating fusillades of fire and deflect blows that would pulverise lesser beings. With their heavy, void-sealed armour, they are ideal for leading assaults into hostile territory.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, ENDURANT

abilities.name: Disengage
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Fall Back action for 1 less AP.

operatives.name: NAVIS GHEISTSKULL
operatives.description: These servo-skulls are often made from the heads of former Imperial Navy Breachers. As a result, they are often named ‘Dead Man’s Revenge’ or regarded as the perished soldier’s ‘Last Laugh’ for their ability to detonate and kill all around them in a final act of defiance towards the enemy.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, GHEISTSKULL

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules:
• This operative cannot be activated or perform actions if it’s within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER VOID-JAMMER operative has been incapacitated. The turning point can end even if this operative is still ready.
• This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back and Reposition.
• It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight, climb or jump.
• Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
• Whenever this operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

actions.name: DETONATE
effects: Select one enemy operative visible to and within 3" of this operative.
Inflict D3+3 damage on that enemy operative and each other operative within 1" of it.
This operative is then immediately incapacitated.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action more than once per battle, and cannot perform it during the first turning point.

operatives.name: NAVIS GRENADIER
operatives.description: It is the life of an Imperial Navy Breacher to become very accustomed to explosions. Even more so for the Grenadiers. These Armsmen carry demolition charges designed to crack through bulkheads and sealed doors, enabling their squadmates to keep moving and reach their objectives.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, GRENADIER

operatives.name: NAVIS GUNNER
operatives.description: The largest troops in the squad who don’t fulfil the role of Endurants carry their squad’s heaviest ranged weapons. A las-volley unleashes devastating salvoes, the searing heat of a meltagun shot burns through a reinforced bulkhead, and even heavily-armoured enemies cannot withstand a plasma gun.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, GUNNER

operatives.name: NAVIS HATCHCUTTER
operatives.description: It is vital for Imperial Navy Breachers to be able to move through enemy ships quickly to reach their objectives. Hatchcutters can not only cut through barricades with their chainfists and plasma torches, they can use the latter to seal shut paths the foe might otherwise use.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, HATCHCUTTER

actions.name: WELD SHUT
effects: Select a closed hatchway (e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark) within this operative’s control range. 1 additional AP must be spent for other operatives to perform the Operate Hatch action to open that hatchway.
This effect ends when that hatchway is opened.
Note this operative isn’t affected by this effect.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if it isn’t within 1" of a closed hatchway.

operatives.name: NAVIS SURVEYOR
operatives.description: Knowing what is around a corner can mean life or death for Imperial Navy Breachers. By using a C.A.T. unit, which is capable of navigating narrow tunnels and holes, a Surveyor can investigate and prepare their squad for what might be ahead.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, SURVEYOR

actions.name: WAYFIND
effects: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative (excluding C.A.T. UNIT or GHEISTSKULL) visible to and within 6" of this operative, or visible to and within 6" of a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER C.A.T. UNIT operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. For the purposes of the Comms Device universal equipment, the operative the distance is being determined from must control that marker.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: NAVIS VOID-JAMMER
operatives.description: It falls to the Void-jammers in an Imperial Navy Breacher kill team to operate gheistskulls – servo-skullls fitted with an explosive device and an electro-magnetic pulse emitter. These devices can move quickly, fly through the air and navigate terrain far too dense for the Armsmen in order to reach the foe.
operatives.keywords: IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER, IMPERIUM, VOID-JAMMER

weapons.name: GHEISTSKULL DETONATOR
weapons.rules: Blast 1", Lethal 5+, Limited 1, Silent, Stun, Detonate*

abilities.name: Detonate*
abilities.rules: Don’t select a valid target. Instead, a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER GHEISTSKULL operative is always the primary target and cannot be in cover or obscured. If that operative isn’t in the killzone, you cannot select this weapon.

strategy_ploys.name: VOID ARMOUR
strategy_ploys.description: The armour worn by Imperial Navy Armsmen is void-sealed, meaning that they can fight in environments devoid of gravity or atmosphere. Such armour also serves to protect them from explosive blasts and flaming torrents.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operative, if the ranged weapon in that sequence has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule (excluding weapons that have a sweeping profile), you can re-roll one of your defence dice, or up to two of your defence dice if that friendly operative is a GRENADIER.

equipment.name: REBREATHERS
equipment.description: These masks recycle a supply of oxygen, allowing the bearer to survive for extended periods in poisonous atmospheres, underwater or in the vacuum of space.
equipment.rules: You can ignore any changes to the APL stats of friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER operatives, and they aren’t affected by enemy operatives’ Shock weapon rule.

equipment.name: RAZOR WIRE
equipment.description: Spooled rapidly out and affixed to jutting posts, razor wire acts as an easily deployed barrier and a painful deterrent to enemy operatives seeking to attack along particular routes.
equipment.rules: Razor wire is Exposed and Obstructing terrain. Before the battle, you can set it up wholly within your territory, on the killzone floor and more than 2" from other equipment terrain features, access points and Accessible terrain.

equipment.name: EXPLOSIVE GRENADES
equipment.description: A variety of offensive grenades are employed by the forces of the 41st Millennium. These range from simple fragmentation grenades to plasma and gravitic concussion grenades, while even more exotic devices are used to crack open enemy armour.
equipment.rules: When you select this equipment, select two explosive grenades (2 frag, 2 krak, or 1 frag and 1 krak). Each selection is a ranged weapon your operatives can use, but your kill team can only use that weapon a total number of times during the battle equal to your selection.

equipment.name: MINES
equipment.description: The battlefields of the 41st Millennium are plagued by myriad types of mine, from simple frag charges to monofilament web-snares and microplasma charges. Ultimately, all serve a similar, horrible purpose.
equipment.rules: Before the battle, you can set up one of your Mines markers wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict D3+3 damage on that operative.

name: INQUISITORIAL AGENTS
description: Few authorities in the Imperium have greater jurisdiction than the Inquisition. An Inquisitor can, on a whim, requisition forces from virtually any of the Imperium’s military branches.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 INQUISITORIAL AGENT INTERROGATOR operative
↘ 1 INQUISITORIAL AGENT TOME-SKULL operative
↘ 5 INQUISITORIAL AGENT operatives selected from the following list:
  • AUTOSAVANT
  • QUESTKEEPER
  • DEATH WORLD VETERAN
  • ENLIGHTENER
  • HEXORCIST
  • MYSTIC
  • PENAL LEGIONNAIRE
  • PISTOLIER
  • GUN SERVITOR with one of the following options:
    ○ Heavy bolter; servo claw
    ○ Multi-melta; servo claw
    ○ Plasma cannon; servo claw
↘ 5 INQUISITORIAL AGENT operatives selected from the list above, or REQUISITIONED operatives from one group in the Inquisitorial Requisition faction rule (you cannot select REQUISITIONED operatives from different groups).
*Your kill team can only include each operative on this list once, unless you’re not including any REQUISITIONED operatives, in which case you can include up to two GUN SERVITOR operatives, but each one must have different options. Your kill team (including any REQUISITIONED operatives) cannot include more than one weapon with the Piercing 2 weapon rule, and cannot include more than three weapons with the Piercing X (excluding Piercing Crits X) weapon rule combined.*

operatives.name: INTERROGATOR
operatives.description: An Inquisitor is the ultimate authority, an individual whose power is second only to the Emperor. They bear the authority to bring planets to their knees, wipe out entire cults and command the might of the Imperium’s forces. Even a junior Interrogator is terrifying to behold, with their force of will alone able to crush all before them.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, LEADER, INTERROGATOR

abilities.name: Inquisitorial Tomes
abilities.rules: STRATEGIC GAMBIT and/or when this operative is activated. Select one of the following INQUISITORIAL TOME rules for this operative to have, and one for a friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENT TOME-SKULL operative to have (they can be the same, and ignore the rule you didn’t select for each operative):

operatives.name: TOME-SKULL
operatives.description: These familiars are specialised servo-skulls designed to secure and hold open a treasured volume. The books chosen by Interrogators for a Tome-skull to bear into the field are seeped in holy power and filled with arcane lore, sanctifying ground and renouncing daemonic spirits.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, TOME-SKULL

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate a ready friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENT INTERROGATOR operative (if able) before your opponent activates. The same is true in reverse (INTERROGATOR followed by TOME-SKULL). When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal.

operatives.name: AUTOSAVANT AGENT
operatives.description: Little remains of the original Human the Autosavant once was. Much of their form has been replaced with bionics dedicated to the recording of information. Whether in their base of operations or the heat of battle, they never cease their scribblings of every word and deed they witness.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, AUTOSAVANT

abilities.name: Irrefutable Report
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative contests an objective marker or one of your mission markers, it always controls that marker. This takes precedence over all other rules.

abilities.name: Lightly Armed
abilities.rules: This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard, or perform unique actions.

operatives.name: QUESTKEEPER AGENT
operatives.description: Questkeepers – known also as Knight-Errants, Penitents and many other names – are fanatical zealots dedicated to the Imperial Creed. With an intense hatred for foes of the Emperor, they execute sworn quests to slaughter heretics and traitors.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, QUESTKEEPER

abilities.name: Irrepressible Purpose
abilities.rules: If this operative is incapacitated while fighting or retaliating, you can strike the enemy operative in that sequence with one of your unresolved successes before this operative is removed from the killzone.

abilities.name: Zealot
abilities.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on this operative, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

operatives.name: DEATH WORLD VETERAN AGENT
operatives.description: Every Inquisitor knows that death worlds produce the toughest soldiers in the Imperium. Many go to great lengths to draft experienced death worlders, for these warriors’ fighting skills are vital for hunting down the heretic.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, DEATH WORLD VETERAN

abilities.name: Hunter
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Charge action while it has a Conceal order.

abilities.name: Weathered
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative is fighting or retaliating, in the Resolve Attack Dice step, you can ignore the damage inflicted on it from one normal success.

operatives.name: ENLIGHTENER AGENT
operatives.description: Known to some as Excruciators or Truth-Peelers, these sadistic individuals are highly valued by Inquisitors for their utter lack of mercy and uncanny skill in extracting valuable information, even from the most uncooperative of prisoners.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, ENLIGHTENER

abilities.name: No Escape
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative would perform the Fall Back action while within control range of this operative, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6, subtracting 1 from the result if that enemy operative has a higher Wounds stat than this operative, and adding 1 if that enemy operative is wounded: on a 4+, that enemy operative cannot perform that action during that activation/counteraction (the AP spent on it isn’t refunded).

abilities.name: Extract Information
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is incapacitated within this operative’s control range, you gain 1CP.

operatives.name: HEXORCIST AGENT
operatives.description: Hexorcists are holy men and women that are often mistaken for priests by the uninitiated. They believe that the Imperial Faith will only be spread at the barrel of a gun, and are experienced enough in the galaxy’s many horrors to know they must fight tooth and nail for it.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, HEXORCIST

abilities.name: Hexorcise
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is visible to and within 6" of this operative, your opponent cannot re-roll their attack or defence dice for that operative.

abilities.name: Lightly Armed
abilities.rules: This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.

actions.name: CHASTEN
effects: Select one enemy operative that's a valid target for this operative and within 6" of it, then select one additional rule (including a unique action) that enemy operative has on its datacard (excluding a weapon rule). Until the end of that enemy operative’s next activation, it’s treated as not having that additional rule.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: MYSTIC AGENT
operatives.description: Using their empyric senses to ‘see’ hidden truths and the souls of those they hunt, Mystics engage in the most arcane of missions. They provide vital support to their team, scrying the future for dangers or creating shields of psychic energy.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, PSYKER, MYSTIC

actions.name: SCRY
effects: PSYCHIC. Select one friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENT operative visible to this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, it has one of the following rules (you can only select each option once per battle):
• Interdict: Whenever that operative is shooting an enemy operative, it can re-roll one of its attack dice.

• Protection: Whenever an operative is shooting the selected operative, in the Roll Defence Dice step, you can retain one of your fails as a normal success instead of discarding it, or retain one of your normal successes as a critical success instead.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: PENAL LEGIONNAIRE AGENT
operatives.description: There are few better sources of expendable fighters with unusual skills and a need for repentance than an Imperial Penal Legion. These hardened criminals are useful with a blade and have nothing left to lose – perfect for the kind of suicidal missions Inquisitorial Agents must face in the Emperor’s service.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, PENAL LEGIONNAIRE

abilities.name: Chem-mask
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to this operative’s APL stat, and any changes to its stats from being injured. This operative isn’t affected by enemy operatives’ Shock and Stun weapon rules.

abilities.name: Cruel
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a wounded enemy operative, this operative’s weapons have the Relentless weapon rule.

operatives.name: PISTOLIER AGENT
operatives.description: Sometimes known as Desperadoes, these Agents are skilled killers who have honed their talents in the crime-ridden underbowels of hive worlds. Alongside the quick draw they have learned the value of the silent kill, as well as the ostentatiously explosive.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, PISTOLIER

abilities.name: Irrepressible Purpose
abilities.rules: If this operative is incapacitated while fighting or retaliating, you can strike the enemy operative in that sequence with one of your unresolved successes before this operative is removed from the killzone.

abilities.name: Zealot
abilities.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage of 3 or more on this operative, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

operatives.name: GUN SERVITOR
operatives.description: More machine than Human, Gun Servitors are commonplace across the Imperium, and lobotomised to the extent that they lack any kind of capacity for independent thought. Used to fulfil mundane and difficult tasks, they carry hefty loads often including heavy weapons.
operatives.keywords: INQUISITORIAL AGENT, IMPERIUM, INQUISITION, GUN SERVITOR

weapons.name: PLASMA CANNON (SUPERCHARGE)
weapons.rules: Blast 2", Heavy (Dash only), Hot, Lethal 5+, Piercing 1

abilities.name: Lobotomised
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is activated, if it’s visible to and within 3" of another friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENT operative (excluding GUN SERVITOR) or vice versa, add 1 to this operative’s APL stat until the end of that activation.

strategy_ploys.name: DENOUNCE
strategy_ploys.description: None escape the long arm of the Inquisition. Those denounced and proclaimed guilty quail before its vengeful Agents.
strategy_ploys.rules: Select one enemy operative and roll one D3. In the Firefight phase of this turning point, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until it's the last enemy operative to be activated, or your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives equal to the result of the D3 (whichever comes first). This ploy costs you 1 additional CP for each previous time you’ve used it during the battle (e.g. 1CP the first time you would use it, 2CP the second time, etc.).

equipment.name: COMMS JAMMERS
equipment.description: The Night Lords use jamming devices to sow chaos and confusion by preventing their panicked foes from communicating.
equipment.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of a friendly NEMESIS CLAW operative, that enemy operative’s APL stat cannot be added to. Note that this doesn’t affect APL stats that have already been changed.

equipment.name: EXPLOSIVE GRENADES
equipment.description: A variety of offensive grenades are employed by the forces of the 41st Millennium. These range from simple fragmentation grenades to plasma and gravitic concussion grenades, while even more exotic devices are used to crack open enemy armour.
equipment.rules: When you select this equipment, select two explosive grenades (2 frag, 2 krak, or 1 frag and 1 krak). Each selection is a ranged weapon your operatives can use, but your kill team can only use that weapon a total number of times during the battle equal to your selection.

equipment.name: MINES
equipment.description: The battlefields of the 41st Millennium are plagued by myriad types of mine, from simple frag charges to monofilament web‑snares and microplasma charges. Ultimately, all serve a similar, horrible purpose.
equipment.rules: Before the battle, you can set up one of your Mines markers wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict D3+3 damage on that operative.

rules.name: INQUISITORIAL REQUISITION
rules.description: Few authorities in the Imperium have greater jurisdiction than the Inquisition. An Inquisitor can, on a whim, requisition forces from virtually any of the Imperium’s military branches.
rules.rules:
REQUISITIONED operatives can be taken from one of the following groups to supplement an INQUISITORIAL AGENT kill team, as specified in this kill team’s selection rules:
  • DEATH KORPS
  • EXACTION SQUAD
  • IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER
  • KASRKIN
  • SISTER OF SILENCE
  • TEMPESTUS SCION
These operatives have their faction keyword replaced in all instances on their datacards with INQUISITORIAL AGENT (unless they already have it). You cannot use ploys and equipment associated with a REQUISITIONED operative’s former faction keyword, and you cannot use a REQUISITIONED operative’s former faction rules unless specified on their Inquisitorial Requisition card (it only applies to those REQUISITIONED operatives). Note that with their new faction keyword, REQUISITIONED operatives can interact with the INQUISITORIAL AGENT rules.
For example, a REQUISITIONED VOX-OPERATOR operative from the DEATH KORPS group would have its DEATH KORPS keyword replaced in all instances on its datacard with INQUISITORIAL AGENT. This allows you to select any other friendly INQUISITORIAL AGENT operative for its Signal unique action. However, the Guardsman Orders faction rule isn’t permitted, so its Relay Orders additional rule would be ignored. It would now also be a valid operative for the INQUISITORIAL AGENT MYSTIC operative’s Scry unique action.

name: KASRKIN
description: The Kasrkin go where they are needed. Battle-hardened, uncompromising and equipped with the best weapons available, these elites pursue their objectives with professionalism, hard-won experience and rigid determination.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 KASRKIN SERGEANT operative with one of the following options:
  • Bolt pistol; power weapon
  • Hot-shot lasgun; gun butt
  • Hot-shot laspistol; power weapon
  • Plasma pistol; chainsword
↘ 9 KASRKIN operatives selected from the following list:
  • COMBAT MEDIC
  • DEMO-TROOPER
  • GUNNER with flamer and gun butt
  • GUNNER with grenade launcher and gun butt
  • GUNNER with hot-shot volley gun and gun butt
  • GUNNER with meltagun and gun butt
  • GUNNER with plasma gun and gun butt
  • RECON-TROOPER
  • SHARPSHOOTER
  • TROOPER
  • VOX-TROOPER
Other than TROOPER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.
You cannot select more than four of these operatives combined.
Some KASRKIN rules refer to a ‘hot-shot weapon’. This is a ranged weapon that includes ‘hot-shot’ in its name, e.g. hot-shot lasgun, all profiles of a hot-shot marksman rifle, etc.

operatives.name: KASRKIN SERGEANT
operatives.description: Kasrkin Sergeants are uncompromising leaders. They issue precise orders and lead from the front, their disciplined ferocity backed up by master-crafted weaponry and decades of hard-won experience.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, LEADER, SERGEANT

operatives.name: KASRKIN COMBAT MEDIC
operatives.description: It falls to the Combat Medics in a Kasrkin kill team to patch up their comrades. Though they are equipped with an array of field medicae equipment, their most potent assets are their determination and hardened battle skills.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, MEDIC, COMBAT MEDIC

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly KASRKIN operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated, has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it’s a Shoot action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target.

operatives.name: KASRKIN DEMO-TROOPER
operatives.description: Demo-troopers are the demolition experts of a Kasrkin kill team. They carry an array of high explosives – from melta bombs to frag grenades – that can blow apart enemy emplacements and armoured vehicles alike.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, DEMO-TROOPER

abilities.name: Blast Padding*
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative with a weapon that has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule (excluding weapons that have a sweeping profile), you can re-roll one of your defence dice. In addition, this operative isn’t affected by the x" Devastating x weapon rule (i.e. Devastating with a distance) unless they are the target during that sequence.

operatives.name: KASRKIN GUNNER
operatives.description: Kasrkin Gunners provide their kill team with superior firepower. Whether it’s the searing heat of a plasma gun or the torrent of fire from a hot-shot volley gun, these elite troops are armed to the teeth to destroy their foes.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, GUNNER

operatives.name: KASRKIN RECON-TROOPER
operatives.description: Recon-troopers are the vanguard of a Kasrkin kill team, equipped with advanced auspex scanners to provide up-to-the-minute battlefield intelligence. They feed their comrades data on enemy movements, and even predict the best locations to aim their hot-shot weapons.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, RECON-TROOPER

actions.name: AUSPEX SCAN
effects: Until the start of this operative’s next activation or until it’s incapacitated (whichever comes first), whenever an enemy operative is within 8" of this operative, that enemy operative is being scanned. Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting an enemy operative that’s being scanned, that enemy operative cannot be obscured.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

operatives.name: KASRKIN SHARPSHOOTER
operatives.description: Sharpshooters are the snipers of a Kasrkin kill team. They wield hot-shot long-las rifles, which are accurate, long-ranged weapons that can penetrate the thickest armour.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, SNIPER, SHARPSHOOTER

abilities.name: Camo Cloak
abilities.rules:
Whenever an operative is shooting this operative:
  • Ignore the Saturate weapon rule.
  • If you can retain any cover saves, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a critical success instead.

abilities.name: Concealed Position*
abilities.rules: This operative can only use this weapon the first time it’s performing the Shoot action during the battle.

operatives.name: KASRKIN TROOPER
operatives.description: Kasrkin Troopers are elite infantry, rigorously trained and equipped with the best weapons available to the Astra Militarum. They are the backbone of any Kasrkin kill team, providing solid support and disciplined fire.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, TROOPER

operatives.name: KASRKIN VOX-TROOPER
operatives.description: Carrying advanced vox systems, these Kasrkin are their kill team’s link with higher command. It is their job to relay orders and intelligence between senior officers and their comrades, all of whom wear their own vox-links for quick, intra-squad communication.
operatives.keywords: KASRKIN, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, VOX-TROOPER

actions.name: VOCALISE ORDERS
effects: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly KASRKIN operative in the killzone. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.
conditions: This operative can perform this action twice during its activation, but cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

strategy_ploys.name: CLEARANCE SWEEP
strategy_ploys.description: After clearing their path, the Kasrkin continue their advance, delivering a crushing assault.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative performs a Charge action during its activation, or when it performs a Fight action during a counteraction, until the end of that action, that friendly operative’s weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

strategy_ploys.name: ELIMINATION PATTERN
strategy_ploys.description: The Kasrkin focus their efforts on particularly dangerous or exposed targets, bringing them down with precise fire.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting against an operative that’s not in cover or is being scanned (see RECON-TROOPER), that weapon has the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule, and if it’s a hot-shot weapon, it also has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule. This isn’t cumulative with being injured.

strategy_ploys.name: FOR CADIA!
strategy_ploys.description: Fueled by grim determination and loyalty to their home world, the Kasrkin fight with an unmatched ferocity.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is fighting, the first time you strike during that sequence, inflict 1 additional damage.

strategy_ploys.name: ICE IN YOUR VEINS
strategy_ploys.description: The Kasrkin are legendary for their composure, even when suffering terrible wounds.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an attack dice inflicts damage on a friendly KASRKIN operative, the first time an attack dice inflicts Normal Dmg of 3 or more on this operative during that sequence, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

strategy_ploys.name: LIGHT ’EM UP
strategy_ploys.description: Kasrkin unleash a withering storm of fire, overwhelming their foes.
strategy_ploys.rules:
Whenever a friendly KASRKIN operative is shooting, its ranged weapons have the Severe weapon rule if any of the following are true for the target:
  • It’s ready.
  • It’s not in cover.
  • It’s being scanned (see RECON-TROOPER).

firefight_ploys.name: NEUTRALISE TARGET
firefight_ploys.description: The Kasrkin exploit every weakness, delivering rapid, disabling blows against their foes.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy after rolling your attack dice for a friendly KASRKIN operative, if it’s shooting an operative that’s expended and is either not in cover or is being scanned (see RECON-TROOPER). You can re-roll any of your attack dice.

equipment.name: EXPLOSIVE GRENADES
equipment.description: A variety of offensive grenades are employed by the forces of the 41st Millennium. These range from simple fragmentation grenades to plasma and gravitic concussion grenades, while even more exotic devices are used to crack open enemy armour.
equipment.rules: When you select this equipment, select two explosive grenades (2 frag, 2 krak, or 1 frag and 1 krak). Each selection is a ranged weapon your operatives can use, but your kill team can only use that weapon a total number of times during the battle equal to your selection.

equipment.name: MINES
equipment.description: The battlefields of the 41st Millennium are plagued by myriad types of mine, from simple frag charges to monofilament web-snares and microplasma charges. Ultimately, all serve a similar, horrible purpose.
equipment.rules: Before the battle, you can set up one of your Mines markers wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict D3+3 damage on that operative.

name: KOMMANDOS
description: Unusually amongst their warlike species, Ork Kommandos have an appreciation for subtlety. They will use any dirty and underhanded trick they can think of to achieve their goals. Of course, when the fight begins, their natural love for violence comes to the fore.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 KOMMANDO BOSS NOB operative with one of the following options:
  • Slugga; big choppa
  • Slugga; power klaw
↘ 9 KOMMANDO operatives selected from the following list:
  • BOMB SQUIG
  • BOY
  • BREACHA BOY
  • BURNA BOY
  • COMMS BOY
  • DAKKA BOY
  • GROT
  • ROKKIT BOY
  • SLASHA BOY
  • SNIPA BOY
Other than BOY operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once.
These operatives count as half a selection each, meaning you can select both of them and it’s treated as one selection in total.

operatives.name: KOMMANDO BOSS NOB
operatives.description: The sneakiest of sneaky gits, Kommando Nobs are both brutal and cunning enough to boss about the most conniving of their species.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, LEADER, BOSS NOB

operatives.name: KOMMANDO BOMB SQUIG
operatives.description: Bomb squigs are among the most dangerous of their kind. In addition to being voracious predators, as the name suggests they carry all manner of explosives. In battle they race for the foe, blowing up enemy troops and destroying their defences.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BOMB SQUIG

abilities.name: Stoopid
abilities.rules: In the Firefight phase, whenever you determine this operative’s order, you cannot select Conceal. This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fight, Reposition and Shoot. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.

abilities.name: Expendable
abilities.rules: This operative is ignored for your opponent’s kill/elimination op (when it’s incapacitated, and when determining your starting number of operatives). It’s also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require operatives to ‘escape’, ‘survive’ or be incapacitated by enemy operatives (if it escapes/survives/is incapacitated, determining how many operatives must escape/survive/be incapacitated, etc.).

operatives.name: KOMMANDO BOY
operatives.description: Kommando Boys are the rank-and-file of a Kommando kill team. They are sneaky and brutal, striking from the shadows with choppas and sluggas.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BOY

operatives.name: KOMMANDO BREACHA BOY
operatives.description: Breacha Boys are specialists in breaching fortifications and tearing through enemy lines. They carry a massive breacher ram to smash through obstacles and bludgeon foes.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BREACHA BOY

actions.name: KUNNIN’ BREACH
effects: Select one terrain feature within this operative’s control range. Until the end of the turning point, that terrain feature is treated as having the ‘Light’ category instead of its current category. This operative is then immediately incapacitated.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or if a terrain feature isn’t within its control range.

operatives.name: KOMMANDO BURNA BOY
operatives.description: Burna Boys are obsessed with fire and mayhem. They wield powerful burnas that can incinerate enemies and melt through fortifications.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BURNA BOY

abilities.name: Torrent 0"*
abilities.rules: Note that Torrent 0" means you cannot select secondary targets, but this weapon still has the Torrent weapon rule for all other rules purposes, e.g. the Condensed Stronghold rule (see Killzone: Volkus, Kill Team Core Book).

operatives.name: KOMMANDO COMMS BOY
operatives.description: There’s no excuse for not following the boss’ plan, no matter how questionably sane it seems. Kommando Comms Boys perform the function of ensuring no Ork ‘forgets’ their orders on the field by relaying the boss’ instructions.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, COMMS BOY

abilities.name: I Got a Plan, Ladz
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative’s activations, it can perform the Pick Up Marker, Place Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP.

actions.name: LISTEN IN
effects: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG) visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.

operatives.name: KOMMANDO DAKKA BOY
operatives.description: Dakka Boys love shooting. They carry a variety of guns, but are most fond of their heavy dakka shootas, which spray bullets at a rapid rate.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, DAKKA BOY

operatives.name: KOMMANDO GROT
operatives.description: Grots are small, cowardly, and often used as cannon fodder by Orks. However, Kommandos find a use for even the lowliest grot, training them to be sneaky and carry out minor tasks.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, GROT

abilities.name: Sneaky Zogger
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

operatives.name: KOMMANDO ROKKIT BOY
operatives.description: Rokkit Boys love big explosions. They carry large rokkit launchas, which can blow apart vehicles and large groups of enemies.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, ROKKIT BOY

operatives.name: KOMMANDO SLASHA BOY
operatives.description: Slasha Boys are melee specialists, dual-wielding massive choppas to tear apart their enemies in close combat.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, SLASHA BOY

operatives.name: KOMMANDO SNIPA BOY
operatives.description: Snipa Boys are the stealthiest of Kommandos, using their scoped big shootas to pick off enemies from a distance with deadly accuracy.
operatives.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, SNIPA BOY

strategy_ploys.name: SKULKING
strategy_ploys.description: Kommandos use their environment to their advantage, disappearing into the shadows to ambush their foes.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KOMMANDO operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

strategy_ploys.name: SMOKE BOMB
strategy_ploys.description: Kommandos deploy choking clouds of smoke, obscuring their movements and disorienting their enemies.
strategy_ploys.rules: Place one of your Smoke Grenade markers wholly within 2" of a friendly KOMMANDO operative. Until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, that Smoke Grenade marker is treated as Obscuring terrain and Dense terrain. Operatives cannot be within the terrain feature.

strategy_ploys.name: THROAT SLITTAS
strategy_ploys.description: Unusual amongst Orks, Kommandos utilise stealth and misdirection to close in before falling upon the enemy with jagged blades drawn.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly KOMMANDO operative fights or retaliates, if it has a Conceal order, you can re-roll one of your attack dice.

equipment.name: DYNAMITE
equipment.description: Kommandos are known to utilise a variety of improvised explosives, the most common of which are bundles of volatile dynamite.
equipment.rules:
Once per battle, a friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT) can use the following ranged weapon:
NAME ATK HIT DMG WR   Dynamite   5 4+ 4/5   Range 4", Blast 1", Heavy (Reposition only), Saturate

equipment.name: HARPOON
equipment.description: This weapon fires a sharp, barbed projectile that snags any foes it doesn’t kill outright, preventing them from moving.
equipment.rules:
Once per turning point, a friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT) can use the following ranged weapon:
NAME ATK HIT DMG WR   Harpoon   4 4+ 4/5   Range 8", Lethal 5+, Stun

equipment.name: MINES
equipment.description: The battlefields of the 41st Millennium are plagued by myriad types of mine, from simple frag charges to monofilament web-snares and microplasma charges. Ultimately, all serve a similar, horrible purpose.
equipment.rules: Before the battle, you can set up one of your Mines markers wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an operative’s control range, remove that marker and inflict D3+3 damage on that operative.

name: LEGIONARIES
description: Legionary kill teams are bitter veterans who possess centuries of combat experience. Some are little more than ravening killers who desire only to reave, slaughter and despoil. Others are devoted worshippers of the Dark Gods, seeking to conduct fell rituals in the hope of pleasing their infernal patrons and attaining greater power. [1]

selection.operatives:
*↘* 1 LEGIONARY operative selected from the following list:
 *  *ASPIRING CHAMPION* with one option from each of the following:
    ○ Bolt pistol, plasma pistol or tainted bolt pistol
    ○ Chainsword, daemon blade, power fist, power maul or power weapon
*↘* 5 LEGIONARY operatives selected from the following list:
*  *ANOINTED*
*  *BALEFIRE ACOLYTE*
*  *BUTCHER*
*  *CHOSEN*
*  *ICON BEARER*
*  *SHRIVETALON*
*  *WARRIOR* with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; chainsword
    ○ Boltgun; fists
*  *GUNNER* with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; flamer; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; meltagun; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; plasma gun; fists
*  *HEAVY GUNNER* with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; heavy bolter; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; missile launcher; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; reaper chaincannon; fists
Other than *WARRIOR* operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [2, 3]

operatives.name: ASPIRING CHAMPION
operatives.description: The leader of a Legionary kill team, possessing enhanced capabilities due to their combat experience and dark pacts. [1, 4]

abilities.name: Daemonic Aura
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative performs the Fall Back action while within control range of this operative, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6: on a 3+, that enemy operative cannot perform that action during that activation/counteraction (the AP spent on it is refunded). [4]

operatives.name: ANOINTED
operatives.description: Some Heretic Astartes thirst for power at any cost, and offer themselves wholly to Chaos. They become willing hosts to the immaterial creatures of the warp. This is a slow and painful process, and those in the early stages are known as Anointed due to their mutations. [5]

abilities.name: Unleash Daemon (partial)
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform the Pick Up Marker or mission actions (excluding Operate Hatch). If it’s carrying a marker, it must immediately perform the Place Marker action for 0AP (this takes precedence over all other rules). Normal and Critical Dmg of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on this operative. If this operative has the NURGLE keyword, you cannot reduce the damage of an attack dice by more than 1. In other words, you cannot use both rules to reduce Normal Dmg of 4 or more by 2. [6, 7]

operatives.name: BALEFIRE ACOLYTE
operatives.description: Balefire Acolytes are psykers blessed by the Chaos Gods with the dark power of the empyrean, which they turn indiscriminately upon the foe. Many also carry blades made even deadlier thanks to the power of the warp they are infused with. [8]

abilities.name: Siphon Life
abilities.rules: When you select this weapon, you can use this rule. If you do, at the start of the Resolve Attack Dice step, select one friendly LEGIONARY operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. For each attack dice you resolve during that step that inflicts damage, that friendly operative regains 1 lost wound, or D3 lost wounds if it was a critical success. You cannot use this weapon rule more than once per turning point. [9]

operatives.name: BUTCHER
operatives.description: Bloodthirsty madmen, Butchers are Heretic Astartes that fight without subtlety of any kind in combat. They deal furious strikes with their enormous chain axes, which can carve enemies to pieces. [5]

abilities.name: Devastating Onslaught
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is fighting or retaliating, enemy operatives cannot assist. At the end of each enemy operative’s activation or counteraction, you can select one enemy operative within 2" of this operative. This operative can perform a free Charge action (you can change its order to Engage to do so), but it cannot move more than 2" and must end that move within control range of that selected operative. [10]

operatives.name: GUNNER
operatives.description: Heretic Astartes bearing heavy weapons provide devastating anti-infantry and anti-armour firepower, dominating large swathes of any killzone. [5]

operatives.name: HEAVY GUNNER
operatives.description: Heretic Astartes bearing heavy weapons provide devastating anti-infantry and anti-armour firepower, dominating large swathes of any killzone. [5]

operatives.name: ICON BEARER
operatives.description: Many Heretic Astartes kill teams include Icon Bearers – warriors bearing totems, banners or standards dedicated to the glory of the Dark Gods. [8]

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 higher. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. [11]

abilities.name: Favoured of the Dark Gods
abilities.rules: In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, if this operative controls an objective marker that isn’t tainted, that objective marker is tainted for the battle and you gain 1CP. Note that if any operative (including enemy operatives) has tainted an objective marker, you cannot taint that objective marker. [11, 12]

operatives.name: SHRIVETALON
operatives.description: Inflicting pain and torture becomes a near addiction for some Heretic Astartes. Those who embrace this propensity become known as Shrivetalons, and they stalk the battlefield looking for enemies to torment. [8]

abilities.name: Vicious Reflexes
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is retaliating, you resolve the first attack dice (i.e. defender instead of attacker). [11]

abilities.name: Horrifying Dismemberment
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative incapacitates an enemy operative while fighting or retaliating, select one other enemy operative visible to and within 3" of either this operative or the incapacitated enemy operative. Subtract 1 from that enemy operative’s APL stat until the end of its next activation. [11]

operatives.name: WARRIOR
operatives.description: Those Night Lords who fight as part of the Nemesis Claws are amongst the most psychotic and savage of all their twisted kind. Whether picking their victims off from range or eviscerating and flensing them at close quarters, they are diabolical foes. [13] (Note: This description is from Nemesis Claw source, assuming generic for Legionary Warrior).

abilities.name: Infernal Pact
abilities.rules: Once per battle, when a friendly LEGIONARY WARRIOR operative is activated, you can use this rule. If you do, change that operative’s Marks of Chaos keyword. [12, 14]

strategy_ploys.name: IMPLACABLE
strategy_ploys.description: Empowered by their transhuman might and the gifts of their daemonic patrons, Legionaries are monstrously resilient. [15]
strategy_ploys.rules: You can ignore any changes to the stats of friendly LEGIONARY operatives from being injured (including their weapons’ stats). Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly LEGIONARY NURGLE operative, weapons with the Piercing 1 weapon rule have the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule instead. [15, 16]

strategy_ploys.name: QUICKSILVER SPEED
strategy_ploys.description: Some amongst the Heretic Astartes are possessed of a fleetness of foot and inhuman agility with which they beguile and confound the foe. [15]
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly LEGIONARY operative that performed an action in which it moved during this turning point is fighting or retaliating, worsen the Hit stat of the enemy operative’s melee weapons by 1. Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly LEGIONARY SLAANESH operative more than 6" from it that performed an action in which it moved during this turning point, worsen the Hit stat of the enemy operative’s weapons by 1. In all cases for this ploy, this isn’t cumulative with being injured. [15-18]

strategy_ploys.name: FICKLE FATES
strategy_ploys.description: With superhuman reactions, a Heretic Astartes warrior can use even fractional glimpses of future events to devastating effect. [17]
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly LEGIONARY TZEENTCH operative is shooting or fighting against a ready enemy operative, that friendly operative’s ranged weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule; or its melee weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule if it’s fighting. Additionally, if the target is within 3", that weapon also has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule. [17, 18]

equipment.name: WARDED ARMOUR
equipment.description: Daubed with profane icons, emblazoned with infernal scripture and blessed by the Ruinous Powers, this power armour possesses unholy resilience. [14]
equipment.rules: STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one friendly LEGIONARY operative. Until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, change that operative’s Save stat to 2+. [14]

rules.name: MARKS OF CHAOS
rules.description: By making dark pacts with the Ruinous Powers, Legionaries may increase their own might. Yet such bargains rarely come without a cost. [19]
rules.rules: Whenever you select a LEGIONARY operative for the battle, you must select one of the following keywords for it to have for that battle: KHORNE, NURGLE, SLAANESH, TZEENTCH, UNDIVIDED. Each operative’s keyword can be different, but a BALEFIRE ACOLYTE operative cannot have the KHORNE keyword. [19]

name: MANDRAKES
description: Crawling and flitting, the Mandrakes creep closer through the shadows with hateful scowls and hungry leers dancing across their inconstant features. Those who survive the impact of their soul-freezing baleblasts soon fall prey to the slash of their glimmersteel blades. [20]

selection.operatives:
*↘* 1 *MANDRAKE NIGHTFIEND* operative
*↘* 8 *MANDRAKE* operatives selected from the following list:
*  *ABYSSAL*
*  *CHOOSER OF THE FLESH*
*  *DIRGEMAW*
*  *SHADEWEAVER*
*  *WARRIOR*
Other than *WARRIOR* operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [21]

operatives.name: NIGHTFIEND
operatives.description: The enigmatic leader of the Mandrake kill team. [21]

abilities.name: Harrowing Whispers
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when your opponent would activate an enemy operative within 6" of this operative, you can roll one D6 (you cannot do so if you also interrupted that operative’s activation with the DIRGEMAW operative’s Haunting Focus additional rule during this turning point): on a 4+, that operative cannot be activated (the AP it would have spent are refunded). If you do so, after completing this operative’s activation, your opponent activates that enemy operative (if possible), or activates a different enemy operative if they can’t. [22, 23]

operatives.name: DIRGEMAW
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

abilities.name: Part Collector
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is incapacitated as a result of this operative’s Part Collector rule or baleblade, you gain 1 Soul Harvest point, or two if that enemy operative had an APL stat of 3 or more. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE operative is activated, you can spend 1 of your Soul Harvest points to either add 1 to its APL stat until the end of the battle, or have it regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. Note you can spend your Soul Harvest points even if this operative is incapacitated. [24]

abilities.name: Haunting Focus
abilities.rules: The next time your opponent would activate an enemy operative that has your Haunting Focus token, if this operative is ready, you can activate this operative first (you cannot do so if you also rolled to prevent that operative’s activation with the NIGHTFIEND operative’s Harrowing Whispers additional rule during this turning point). After completing this operative’s activation, your opponent activates that enemy operative (if possible), or activates a different enemy operative if they can’t. [22]

operatives.name: SHADEWEAVER
operatives.description: Shadeweavers manipulate the stuff of darkness. They are able to leech away natural and artificial light alike, plunging areas into a cloying gloom that even hardened sensors cannot pierce. Twisting the penumbral threads of their weave, they deepen the darkness further until it bores tunnels through reality itself. [20]

actions.name: WEAVE DARKNESS
effects: Until the end of this operative’s next activation, whenever a friendly MANDRAKE operative is visible to and within 6" of this operative and has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2". Place one of your Weave Darkness markers within this operative’s control range. [25]

operatives.name: WARRIOR
operatives.description: Crawling and flitting, the Mandrakes creep closer through the shadows with hateful scowls and hungry leers dancing across their inconstant features. Those who survive the impact of their soul-freezing baleblasts soon fall prey to the slash of their glimmersteel blades. [20]

abilities.name: Shadow Warrior
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is WITHIN SHADOW, add 1 to the Critical Dmg stat of its glimmersteel blade. [25]

equipment.name: CHAIN SNARE
equipment.description: Composed of hooked blades attached to a length of chain, this weapon bites into the flesh or armour of the wielder’s target, preventing them from fleeing. [26]
equipment.rules: Whenever an enemy operative would perform the Fall Back action while within control range of a friendly MANDRAKE operative, if no other enemy operatives are within that friendly operative’s control range, you can use this rule. If you do, roll two D6, or one D6 if that enemy operative has a higher Wounds stat than that friendly operative. If any result is a 4+, that enemy operative cannot perform that action during that activation/counteraction (no AP are spent on it). [26]

rules.name: SOULSTRIKE
rules.description: The balefire hurled by the Mandrakes burns cold and fierce, fed by the tinder of their victim’s life force and animus. Conventional armour offers little protection against this insidious force. [27]
rules.rules: Successful defence dice are determined differently. Each result that’s equal to or less than the target’s APL stat is a success and is retained. Each result that’s higher than the target’s APL stat is a fail and is discarded. Each result of 1 is always a critical success. Each other success is a normal success. Each result of 6 is always a fail. [28]

name: NEMESIS CLAW
description: Savage and sadistic in the extreme, the Night Lords use fear itself as their most potent weapon. The cruelist of these inveterate murderers form kill teams known as Nemesis Claws, achieving their mission objectives through acts of obscene violence and the spreading of abject terror. [29]

selection.operatives:
*↘* 1 *NEMESIS CLAW VISIONARY* operative with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; power fist
    ○ Bolt pistol; power maul
    ○ Bolt pistol; power weapon
    ○ Plasma pistol; Nostraman chainblade
*↘* 5 *NEMESIS CLAW* operatives selected from the following list:
*  *FEARMONGER*
*  *SCREECHER*
*  *SKINTHIEF*
*  *VENTRILOKAR*
*  *WARRIOR* with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; chainsword
    ○ Boltgun; fists
*  *GUNNER* with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; flamer; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; meltagun; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; plasma gun; fists
*  *HEAVY GUNNER* with one of the following options:
    ○ Bolt pistol; heavy bolter; fists
    ○ Bolt pistol; missile launcher; fists
Other than *WARRIOR* operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [30-32]

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD VISIONARY
operatives.description: It takes a singularly terrifying being to lead such a band of monsters to battle, yet the Visionary is equal to the task. Gifted with instinctual flickers of prescience, they foresee threats from within their Nemesis Claw and without, meeting them with shocking violence. [29]

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD FEARMONGER
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

weapons.name: TERRORCHEM VIAL
weapons.rules: Range 6", Blast 2", Devastating 3, Limited 1, Saturate, Terrorchem*

abilities.name: Terrorchem
abilities.rules: In the Resolve Attack Dice step, if you inflict damage with any critical successes, the operative this weapon is being used against gains one of your Terrorchem tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). [33]

abilities.name: Terrorchem Poison
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative that has one of your Terrorchem tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it. [29, 34]

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD GUNNER
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD HEAVY GUNNER
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD SKINTHIEF
operatives.description: The 'Tzann the Ghoul, Skinthief' is characterized by his sadistic nature, enjoying the hunt and torment of his prey. [35]

abilities.name: Flay Them Alive
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, when this operative incapacitates an enemy operative within its control range, you can select one other enemy operative visible to and within 6" of either this operative or the incapacitated enemy operative. Until the start of the next turning point, that other enemy operative cannot control markers or perform the Pick Up Marker or mission actions. [36]

abilities.name: Tyrant of the Skinning Pits
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is fighting or retaliating, Normal and Critical Dmg of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it. [37]

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD VENTRILOKAR
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

abilities.name: Icon Bearer
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 higher. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. [38]

actions.name: DISCONCERTING MIMICRY
effects:
*PSYCHIC*. Select one enemy operative within 6" of this operative, then select one of the following for that enemy operative (you can only select each option once per battle):
*  Until the end of its next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat.
*  Change its order.
*  Perform a free Dash action with it (specify the location for your opponent to move it to).
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative. [38, 39]

operatives.name: NIGHT LORD WARRIOR
operatives.description: Those Night Lords who fight as part of the Nemesis Claws are amongst the most psychotic and savage of all their twisted kind. Whether picking their victims off from range or eviscerating and flensing them at close quarters, they are diabolical foes. [13]

abilities.name: Cruel Tormenter
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an injured enemy operative, or an enemy operative that has a Wounds stat of 7 or less, this operative’s weapons have the Lethal 5+ weapon rule. [40]

strategy_ploys.name: THE BLACK HUNT
strategy_ploys.description: A terrible malice burns within the twin hearts of each Night Lord, and they enjoy nothing more than toying with their wounded prey. [31]
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly NEMESIS CLAW operative is shooting or fighting against a wounded enemy operative, that friendly operative’s weapons have the Balanced weapon rule. If that enemy operative is also injured, that weapon also has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule. [31]

strategy_ploys.name: RETURN TO DARKNESS
strategy_ploys.description: (No description provided in excerpt).
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly NEMESIS CLAW operative performs a Fall Back action, it can move an additional 2". In addition, it cannot end that move closer to enemy operatives (in a killzone that uses the close quarters rules, e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark, ignore Wall terrain when determining this). [41]

firefight_ploys.name: DEATH TO THE FALSE EMPEROR
firefight_ploys.description: (No description provided in excerpt).
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy after rolling your attack dice for a friendly NEMESIS CLAW operative, if it’s shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an enemy operative that has the IMPERIUM keyword. [41]

equipment.name: COMMS JAMMERS
equipment.description: (No description provided in excerpt).
equipment.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 3" of a friendly NEMESIS CLAW operative, worsen the Hit stat of that enemy operative’s weapons by 1. This isn’t cumulative with being injured. Each enemy operative can only be affected by this rule once per turning point. [41]

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: These genetically modified superhumans are made for one purpose: war. [39]
rules.rules: During each friendly NEMESIS CLAW operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or scoped bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them. This operative can counteract regardless of its order. [39]

name: NOVITIATES
description: Novitiate kill teams are composed of fresh Sisters in training, eager to prove their faith to the Emperor. They engage in battle with fanatical zeal, their fervent prayers and righteous fury capable of empowering their attacks and inspiring their comrades to ever greater acts of devotion.

selection.operatives:
*↘* 1 *NOVITIATE SUPERIOR* operative with one of the following options:
    ○ Plasma pistol; power weapon
    ○ Relic boltgun; gun butt
    ○ Relic bolt pistol; power weapon
*↘* 9 *NOVITIATE* operatives selected from the following list:
*  *CONDEMNOR*
*  *DIALOGUS*
*  *DUELLIST*
*  *EXACTOR*
*  *HOSPITALLER*
*  *PENITENT*
*  *PRECEPTOR*
*  *PRONATUS*
*  *PURGATUS*
*  *RELIQUARIUS*
*  *MILITANT* with one of the following options:
    ○ Autopistol; Novitiate blade
    ○ Autogun; gun butt
Other than *MILITANT* and *PURGATUS* operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to two *PURGATUS* operatives. [42, 43]

operatives.name: NOVITIATE SUPERIOR
operatives.description: The leader of the Novitiate kill team, guiding their sisters with unwavering faith and martial prowess. [42]

operatives.name: NOVITIATE CONDEMNOR
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

abilities.name: Psychic Null
abilities.rules: PSYCHIC ranged weapons cannot inflict damage on this operative. For the effects of PSYCHIC actions, this operative cannot be selected and is never treated as being within those actions’ required distances. Whenever an operative is within 6" of this operative: That operative cannot perform PSYCHIC actions or use PSYCHIC additional rules. That operative cannot use PSYCHIC ranged weapons. PSYCHIC melee weapons have no weapon rules and cannot have Dmg stats higher than 3/4. [44, 45]

abilities.name: Anti-PSYKER
abilities.rules: Whenever this weapon is being used against an operative that has the PSYKER keyword, add 1 to both Dmg stats of this weapon and it has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule. [45]

operatives.name: NOVITIATE DIALOGUS
operatives.description: These Novitiates are in training to join the Orders Dialogus, while learning warfare under the guidance of experienced Battle Sisters. Their training in cryptography makes them of great value to kill teams – they can unlock obscure ciphers and find hidden patterns in communiques. [46]

abilities.name: Inspiring Oration
abilities.rules: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly NOVITIATE operative visible to and within 3" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. If you do, you gain 1 Faith point. [45]

operatives.name: NOVITIATE DUELLIST
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

abilities.name: Deadly Flourish
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative fights or retaliates, after rolling your attack dice, if you have two or more critical successes, you can re-roll one of your normal successes. If you do, it becomes a critical success instead. [47]

operatives.name: NOVITIATE MILITANT
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

operatives.name: NOVITIATE PENITENT
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

operatives.name: NOVITIATE PRECEPTOR
operatives.description: These Novitiates are expected to rigidly enforce their Order’s precepts, ensuring their fellows faithfully adhere to the prescribed standards. They are often chosen as their Superior’s second in command, and serve as exemplars by eagerly striding into the fray to smite the Emperor’s foes. [46]

abilities.name: Unflinching Example
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative incapacitates a ready enemy operative within its control range, you gain 1 Faith point, or 2 Faith points if that enemy operative had a Wounds stat of 12 or more. [48]

abilities.name: Glorious Hymnal
abilities.rules: SUPPORT. Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE operative is within 3" of this operative, that friendly operative’s weapons have the Severe weapon rule. [48]

operatives.name: NOVITIATE PURGATUS
operatives.description: (No specific description provided in excerpt).

abilities.name: Purge with Flame
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, you can use the Inferno firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified friendly NOVITIATE operative. [49]

strategy_ploys.name: DEFENDERS OF THE FAITH
strategy_ploys.description: (No description provided in excerpt).
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a friendly NOVITIATE operative that contests an objective marker or one of your mission markers, in the Resolve Attack Dice step of that sequence, you can halve the damage inflicted (rounding up and to a minimum of 2) on that friendly operative from one normal success. [50]

strategy_ploys.name: BLESSED REJUVENATION
strategy_ploys.description: (No description provided in excerpt).
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever you spend Faith points, at the end of that action, the friendly operative you spent them on can regain up to D3 lost wounds. [50]

firefight_ploys.name: GLORIOUS MARTYRDOM
firefight_ploys.description: (No description provided in excerpt).
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NOVITIATE operative is incapacitated, before it’s removed from the killzone. [51]

equipment.name: ICON OF FAITH
equipment.description: Holy icons of the Ecclesiarchy hold great significance to the Sisters who bear them, reinforcing their faith in the heart of battle. [52]
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, you can use up to two ACTS OF FAITH during a sequence, but each one must be different. This takes precedence over the normal ACTS OF FAITH rules. [52]

rules.name: ACTS OF FAITH
rules.description: Novitiates harness their fervent faith to perform miraculous acts on the battlefield. [48, 50, 52, 53]
rules.rules: Your kill team generates Faith points, which can be spent to empower their actions or activate special abilities. The accumulation and expenditure of Faith points are central to the Novitiates' combat style.

name: PATHFINDERS
description: Specialist reconnaissance infantry, T’au Pathfinders range far ahead of their allies. Pathfinder kill teams are capable of operating independently of the main T’au force, and are equipped for almost any situation. Their advanced wargear and potent weaponry enable them to disrupt communications, perform acts of sabotage and destroy targets [1].

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 PATHFINDER SHAS’UI operative
↘ 11 PATHFINDER operatives selected from the following list:
 * ASSAULT GRENADIER
 * BLOODED
 * COMMS SPECIALIST
 * DRONE CONTROLLER
 * MARKSMAN
 * MEDICAL TECHNICIAN
 * SHAS’LA
 * TRANSPECTRAL INTERFERENCE
 * WEAPONS EXPERT with one of the following options:
   ○ Ion rifle; gun butt
   ○ Rail rifle; gun butt
 * MB3 RECON DRONE (counts as two selections)
 * MV31 PULSE ACCELERATOR DRONE
 * MV33 GRAV-INHIBITOR DRONE
 * MV1 GUN DRONE
 * MV4 SHIELD DRONE
 * MV7 MARKER DRONE
Other than SHAS’LA and WEAPONS EXPERT operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to two WEAPONS EXPERT operatives [2-4].

operatives.name: SHAS’UI PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Shas’ui Pathfinders are veteran warriors who have fought in many campaigns. They have passed dangerous trials of fire to reach the rank, and are dynamic and accomplished tacticians more than capable of leading their team to victory [1].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, LEADER, SHAS’UI

abilities.name: Veteran
abilities.rules: During a turning point in which you have used a friendly SHAS’UI operative’s Art of War STRATEGIC GAMBIT and you selected Mont’ka, this operative can use Kauyon instead during its activation (and vice versa) [5].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [5].

operatives.name: ASSAULT GRENADIER PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Assault Grenadier Pathfinders are specialist reconnaissance infantry [1, 6].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, ASSAULT GRENADIER

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [6].

actions.name: SIGNAL
actions.rules: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly PATHFINDER operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative [6].

operatives.name: BLOODED PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Many experienced and respected Pathfinders earn the personal name of Mont’yr, which translates as ‘Blooded’. Many bear highly advanced bionics in place of lost limbs, and are entrusted with specialist technology such as suppressed weapons [7]. Note: Specific weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts beyond its basic stats [5].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, BLOODED

operatives.name: COMMS SPECIALIST PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Comms Specialist Pathfinders are part of Pathfinder kill teams [1].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, COMMS SPECIALIST

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [8].

actions.name: SIGNAL
actions.rules: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly PATHFINDER operative visible to and within 6" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative [6].

operatives.name: DRONE CONTROLLER PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Drone Controllers are part of Pathfinder kill teams [1].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, DRONE CONTROLLER

abilities.name: Drone Controller
abilities.rules:
Whenever this operative is in the killzone:
 * Add 2" to the Move stat of friendly PATHFINDER DRONE operatives.
 * The Saviour Protocols firefight ploy costs you 0CP [9].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [9].

operatives.name: MARKSMAN PATHFINDER
