operatives.description: Marksman Pathfinders carry customised rail rifles with advanced optics and sophisticated inertial dampeners to ensure incredible accuracy. These Pathfinders are also issued with experimental dart ammunition that is all but inaudible to the foe when fired [10].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MARKSMAN

abilities.name: Inertial Dampener
abilities.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Hit stat of this operative’s marksman rail rifle [11].

operatives.name: MEDICAL TECHNICIAN PATHFINDER
operatives.description: In a Pathfinder kill team, the lives of the T’au are often in the hands of a Medical Technician. These selfless healers brave storms of enemy fire to reach the wounded [10].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MEDICAL TECHNICIAN

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding DRONE) would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated, has 1 wound remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it’s a Shoot action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target [12, 13].

actions.name: MEDIKIT
actions.rules: Select one friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding DRONE) within this operative’s control range to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative [14].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [15].

operatives.name: SHAS’LA PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Even the rank-and-file of Pathfinder teams are selfless adherents to the Greater Good, eagerly volunteering themselves for the most dangerous missions. They operate close to the enemy to learn all they can of them, as well as engaging them when necessary [7].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, SHAS’LA

abilities.name: Group Activation
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly PATHFINDER SHAS’LA operative (if able) before your opponent activates. When that other operative is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two operatives in succession with this rule) [11].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [11].

operatives.name: TRANSPECTRAL INTERFERENCE PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Transpectral Interference Pathfinders are part of Pathfinder kill teams [1].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, TRANSPECTRAL INTERFERENCE

actions.name: MULTI-DIMENSIONAL VISION
actions.rules: Until the start of this operative’s next activation, whenever it’s shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative [15].

actions.name: SYSTEM JAM
actions.rules: Select one enemy operative visible to this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat. This operative cannot perform this action while it has a Conceal order, or while within control range of an enemy operative [16].

operatives.name: WEAPONS EXPERT PATHFINDER
operatives.description: Weapons Experts Pathfinders wield their kill team’s heavy weapons. Their task is a relatively simple one – to kill or destroy what their Shas’ui orders them to or what they deem to be an important target [10].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, WEAPONS EXPERT

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [14].

operatives.name: MV1 GUN DRONE
operatives.description: Using anti-gravitic motors and jet-thrusters, Gun Drones hover over the landscape, moving quickly to engage the enemy and record battlefield data. On kill team missions they can distract enemies while the Pathfinders carry out their tasks as well as partake in attacks alongside the T’au warriors they serve [17].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV1 GUN, DRONE

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
* This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight, Reposition and Shoot. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
* Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head [16, 18].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [18].

operatives.name: MB3 RECON DRONE
operatives.description: These large drones are capable of collecting swathes of vital battlefield data that can make the difference between victory and defeat. Being larger, they can also be mounted with heavier weaponry [17].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MB3 RECON, DRONE

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
* This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight, Markerlight, Reposition and Shoot. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
* Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head [19, 20].

abilities.name: Analyse
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Markerlight action, each other enemy operative that’s both visible to this operative and within 3" of the enemy operative you selected for that action also gains one of your Markerlight tokens [19].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [19].

operatives.name: MV31 PULSE ACCELERATOR DRONE
operatives.description: Pulse Accelerator Drones boost the pulse weapons carried by Pathfinders, making the technology much more powerful and giving them a vital edge against the enemy [21].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV31 PULSE ACCELERATOR, DRONE

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
* This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight, Pulse Accelerator and Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
* Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head [22].

operatives.name: MV33 GRAV-INHIBITOR DRONE
operatives.description: Grav-inhibitor Drones are capable of manipulating gravity around and significantly slow the progress of oncoming enemy troops. On countless occasions have Pathfinder kill teams escaped almost certain death thanks to the technology carried by these drones [21].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV33 GRAV-INHIBITOR, DRONE

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
* This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight and Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
* Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head [22].

abilities.name: Grav-Inhibitor Field
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 6" of this operative, subtract 2" from that enemy operative’s Move stat [22].

operatives.name: MV4 SHIELD DRONE
operatives.description: Shield Drones are fitted with shield generators rather than weaponry. It is their task to protect the Pathfinders they accompany. Their saviour protocols ensure that should a T’au come under direct threat, the Shield Drone will move with remarkable speed to protect them from harm [23].
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV4 SHIELD, DRONE

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
* This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight and Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
* Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head [24].

abilities.name: Shield Generator
abilities.rules:
* This operative ignores the Piercing weapon rule.
* Once per turning point, when an attack dice inflicts Normal Dmg on this operative, you can ignore that inflicted damage.
* You can use the Saviour Protocols firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified DRONE operative [24].

operatives.name: MV7 MARKER DRONE
operatives.description: The high-intensity markerlights used by Marker Drones are vital for the synergy of T’au forces. They indicate priority targets both for the Pathfinders they are alongside as well as other powerful T’au assets. Whatever they pick out will soon be obliterated by overwhelming firepower [23]. Note: Base stats and weapons for this operative are not fully detailed in the provided source excerpts; stats are inferred from similar drones.
operatives.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, MV7 MARKER, DRONE

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules:
* This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight, Markerlight and Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard.
* Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head [18].

abilities.name: High-intensity Markerlight
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Markerlight action, the selected enemy operative gains two of your Markerlight tokens (instead of one) [18].

actions.name: MARKERLIGHT
actions.rules: See the Markerlights faction rule [18].

strategy_ploys.name: RECON SWEEP
strategy_ploys.description: Pathfinders are tasked with reconnaissance roles and are skilled at crossing difficult terrain to outflank unsuspecting targets [25].
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 1" less (to a minimum of 2"). Note this has no effect when using ladder equipment terrain features, which treats the vertical distance as 1" (but would have an effect if the operative then continued climbing another terrain feature) [25].

firefight_ploys.name: A WORTHY CAUSE
firefight_ploys.description: Any action that furthers the Greater Good must be undertaken swiftly and without question, no matter how dangerous [26].
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy at the start of the Firefight phase. One friendly PATHFINDER operative (excluding DRONE) can immediately perform a free mission action [26].

firefight_ploys.name: SUPPORTING FIRE
firefight_ploys.description: T’au Pathfinders are expert sharpshooters and can grant covering fire even to allies engaged in close combat [26].
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PATHFINDER operative is performing the Shoot action and you’re selecting a valid target within 6" of it. Having other friendly PATHFINDER operatives within an enemy operative’s control range doesn’t prevent that enemy operative from being selected [26].

equipment.name: PHOTON GRENADE
equipment.description: Photon Grenades are throwable devices [27].
equipment.rules:
Once per turning point, a friendly PATHFINDER operative that has the Markerlight action on their datacard (excluding DRONE) can perform the following unique action:
PHOTON GRENADE 1AP Select a valid target for this operative and roll one D6: on a 3+, until the end of that operative’s next activation, subtract 2" from its Move stat and it cannot perform the Dash action. An operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative [27].

equipment.name: ORBITAL SURVEY UPLINK
equipment.description: So effective are the scanning matrices of T’au voidships that they can detect and illuminate a single infantry target, even from orbit [27].
equipment.rules: Once per battle, after rolling off to decide initiative, you can use this rule. If you do, you can re-roll your dice [27].

rules.name: MARKERLIGHTS
rules.description: Markerlights are precision targeting beams used by T'au forces [5, 6, 9, 14, 15, 18, 19, 23].
rules.rules:
Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER operative performs the Markerlight action on their datacard, the selected enemy operative gains one of your Markerlight tokens (if it doesn’t already have one) [5, 6, 9, 14, 15, 18, 19].
Whenever an enemy operative has one of your Markerlight tokens:
 * Whenever an operative is shooting that enemy operative, you can re-roll one of your attack dice.
 * Whenever that enemy operative performs a Normal Move, Dash, Charge or Fall Back action, subtract 2" from its Move stat [6].

name: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM
description: Masters of stealth and subterfuge, Phobos Strike Teams consist of Space Marine Infiltrators, Incursors and Reivers. Possessed of transhuman strength and equipped with a range of explosives, communications equipment and precise weaponry, they are capable of outmanoeuvring and overwhelming enemy forces many times their own size [28].

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative selected from the following list:
 * INFILTRATOR SERGEANT
 * INCURSOR SERGEANT
 * REIVER SERGEANT with one of the following options:
   ○ Special issue bolt pistol; combat knife
   ○ Bolt carbine; fists
↘ 5 PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives selected from the following list:
 * INFILTRATOR COMMSMAN
 * INFILTRATOR HELIX ADEPT
 * INFILTRATOR SABOTEUR
 * INFILTRATOR VETERAN
 * INFILTRATOR VOXBREAKER
 * INFILTRATOR WARRIOR
 * INCURSOR MARKSMAN
 * INCURSOR MINELAYER
 * INCURSOR WARRIOR
 * REIVER WARRIOR with one of the following options:
   ○ Special issue bolt pistol; combat knife
   ○ Bolt carbine; fists
Other than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once [29, 30].

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR SERGEANT
operatives.description: Exemplar to their brothers; strategic and tactical leader of exceptional skill; deadly enemy to the Emperor’s foes: the Infiltrator Sergeant must be all of these things, for it is by his words and actions that the Phobos Strike Team stands or falls [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, LEADER, INFILTRATOR, SERGEANT

abilities.name: Strategic Oversight
abilities.rules: In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, when you gain CP, if this operative is in the killzone and not within control range of enemy operatives, you can use this rule. If you do, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain one additional CP [31].

abilities.name: Comms Array
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, during a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation or counteraction, before or after it performs an action, if this operative is in the killzone, you can change one strategy ploy you’ve used this turning point (it doesn’t cost you any CP to do so) [31].

operatives.name: INCURSOR SERGEANT
operatives.description: Incursor Sergeants lead their Incursor battle-brothers [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, LEADER, INCURSOR, SERGEANT

operatives.name: REIVER SERGEANT
operatives.description: Reiver Sergeants lead their Reiver battle-brothers [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, LEADER, REIVER, SERGEANT

abilities.name: Grav-chute and Grapnel Launcher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). Whenever this operative is dropping, ignore the vertical distance [32, 33].

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP [32].

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR COMMSMAN
operatives.description: The Infiltrator Commsman acts as a strategic nexus upon the battlefield, a conduit through which vox-exchanges and intelligence inloads pass like lightning. The presence of such a battle-brother increases the strike team’s versatility and swiftness of action [34].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INFILTRATOR, COMMSMAN

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR HELIX ADEPT
operatives.description: Operating as they do – far behind enemy lines without support – Phobos Strike Teams require the medicae support of Helix Adepts to get wounded battle-brothers back into the fight, and to reclaim the gene-seed of the slain for the Chapter [34].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, MEDIC, INFILTRATOR, HELIX ADEPT

abilities.name: Medic!
abilities.rules: The first time during each turning point that another friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative would be incapacitated while visible to and within 3" of this operative, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that operative is within control range of an enemy operative. If you do, that friendly operative isn’t incapacitated, has D3 wounds remaining and cannot be incapacitated for the remainder of the action. After that action, that friendly operative can immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move within this operative’s control range. Subtract 1 from this and that operative’s APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that friendly operative’s activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this operative is incapacitated, or if it’s a Shoot action and this operative would be a primary or secondary target [33, 35].

actions.name: HELIX GAUNTLET
actions.rules: Select one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative within this operative’s control range to regain up to D3+3 lost wounds. It cannot be an operative that the Medic! rule was used on during this turning point. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative [36].

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR SABOTEUR
operatives.description: Infiltrator Saboteurs are part of Phobos Strike Teams [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INFILTRATOR, SABOTEUR

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR VETERAN
operatives.description: Infiltrator Veterans are part of Phobos Strike Teams [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INFILTRATOR, VETERAN

abilities.name: Custom
abilities.rules: At the end of the Select Operatives step, if this operative is selected for deployment, select up to two of the following weapon rules for this weapon to have for the battle: Balanced, Lethal 5+, Piercing Crits 1, Rending, Saturate [37].

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR VOXBREAKER
operatives.description: The Voxbreaker makes war in both the physical and data-spectral realms. Not only does their specialised equipment allow them to scan and isolate enemy threats, but they can also break into the foe’s communications and plunder them for strategic intelligence [38].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INFILTRATOR, VOXBREAKER

abilities.name: Voxbreak
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative is within 6" of this operative, your opponent cannot re-roll their attack or defence dice for that operative [39].

actions.name: AUSPEX SCAN
actions.rules: Until the start of this operative’s next activation or until it’s incapacitated (whichever comes first), whenever a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is shooting an enemy operative within 8" of this operative, that enemy operative cannot be obscured; if that friendly operative is an INCURSOR, its ranged weapons also have the Seek Light weapon rule [39].

operatives.name: INFILTRATOR WARRIOR
operatives.description: The Infiltrators who fight as part of Phobos Strike Teams are swift and aggressive in thought and deed, even by the standards of their warrior brotherhood. Few foes can long evade their pinpoint volleys or the bone-crushing blows of their armoured fists [38].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INFILTRATOR, WARRIOR

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP [40].

operatives.name: INCURSOR MARKSMAN
operatives.description: Incursor Marksmans are part of Phobos Strike Teams [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INCURSOR, MARKSMAN

abilities.name: Track Target
abilities.rules: This operative can perform the Guard action regardless of the killzone (see close quarters rules, Kill Team Core Book). It can perform the Guard action while it has a Conceal order, but when you perform the free Shoot or Fight action during the interruption, you must change its order to Engage [41].

operatives.name: INCURSOR MINELAYER
operatives.description: Incursor Minelayers are part of Phobos Strike Teams [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INCURSOR, MINELAYER

abilities.name: Haywire Mine
abilities.rules: This operative is carrying your Haywire Mine marker. It can perform the Pick Up Marker action on that marker, but that marker cannot be placed within an enemy operative’s control range (if this operative is incapacitated while carrying that marker and that marker cannot be placed, it’s removed with this operative) [42].

operatives.name: INCURSOR WARRIOR
operatives.description: Incursor Warriors are part of Phobos Strike Teams [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INCURSOR, WARRIOR

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP [43].

operatives.name: REIVER WARRIOR
operatives.description: Reiver Warriors are part of Phobos Strike Teams [28].
operatives.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, REIVER, WARRIOR

abilities.name: Grav-chute and Grapnel Launcher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). Whenever this operative is dropping, ignore the vertical distance [32, 33].

abilities.name: Vanguard
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative with this rule can perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action for 1 less AP [32].

equipment.name: PURITY SEALS
equipment.description: Awarded by the Chapter’s Chaplains, purity seals are inscribed with blessings and inspire the bearer to fight with increased vigour [44].
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a normal success instead [44].

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: These genetically modified superhumans are made for one purpose: war [45].
rules.rules:
During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them. A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes ‘bolt’ in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.
Each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative can counteract regardless of its order [45].

rules.name: MULTI-SPECTRUM ARRAY
rules.description: Feeding into the auto-senses of the bearer’s armour, the multi-spectrum array’s powerful augurs help to reveal hidden foes [46].
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly INCURSOR operative is shooting, enemy operatives cannot be obscured [46].

rules.name: DURABLE
rules.description: Phobos Strike Team operatives possess transhuman durability [47].
rules.rules: You can ignore any changes to the stats of friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operatives from being injured (including their weapons’ stats) [47].

rules.name: DEADLY SHOTS
rules.description: Space Marines spend countless hours perfecting their marksmanship [47].
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM operative is shooting during an activation in which it hasn’t performed the Charge, Fall Back or Reposition action, or against an operative that isn’t in cover, that friendly operative’s ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule. Note that for the first requirement, that operative isn’t restricted from performing those actions after shooting [47].

name: PLAGUE MARINES
description: Plague Marine kill teams are made up of mutated, diseased warriors [48].

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 PLAGUE MARINE CHAMPION operative
↘ 5 PLAGUE MARINE operatives selected from the following list:
 * BOMBARDIER
 * FIGHTER
 * HEAVY GUNNER
 * ICON BEARER
 * MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER
 * WARRIOR
Your kill team can only include each operative on this list once [49].

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE CHAMPION
operatives.description: Plague Marine Champions lead their kill teams [50].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, LEADER, CHAMPION

abilities.name: Grandfather’s Blessing
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative that has one of your Poison tokens loses one or more wounds within 7" of this operative, this operative regains up to an equal number of lost wounds (to a maximum of 3 lost wounds per turning point, and only if this operative isn’t incapacitated) [51, 52].

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE BOMBARDIER
operatives.description: Plague Marine Bombardiers are equipped with plague spewers [51].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, BOMBARDIER

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE FIGHTER
operatives.description: Plague Marine Fighters wield flails of corruption [53].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, FIGHTER

actions.name: FLAIL
actions.rules: Inflict D3+2 damage on each other operative that’s both visible to and within 2" of this operative. Roll separately for each: if it’s an enemy operative, if the D3 result is a 3, that enemy operative also gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). This operative cannot perform this action while it has a Conceal order, or during an activation in which it performed more than one Fight action, and it cannot perform more than one Fight action during an activation in which it performs this action [50, 54].

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE HEAVY GUNNER
operatives.description: Plague Marine Heavy Gunners bring potent ranged firepower [51].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, HEAVY GUNNER

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE ICON BEARER
operatives.description: Many Heretic Astartes kill teams include Icon Bearers – warriors bearing totems, banners or standards dedicated to the glory of the Dark Gods [55].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, ICON BEARER

abilities.name: Icon of Contagion
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is within your opponent’s territory, the Contagion strategy ploy costs you 0CP [54].

operatives.name: MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER
operatives.description: Balefire Acolytes are psykers blessed by the Chaos Gods with the dark power of the empyrean, which they turn indiscriminately upon the foe [55]. Malignant Plaguecasters spread Nurgle's blighted gifts [56].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, PSYKER, MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER

actions.name: PUTRESCENT VITALITY
actions.rules: SUPPORT. Select one friendly PLAGUE MARINE operative visible to and within 6" of this operative to regain D3 lost wounds. That operative can then immediately perform a free Dash action, but must end that move closer to this operative. This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative, or more than once per turning point [48, 57].

operatives.name: PLAGUE MARINE WARRIOR
operatives.description: Plague Marine Warriors are standard operatives in a Plague Marine kill team [49].
operatives.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, WARRIOR

abilities.name: Repulsive Fortitude
abilities.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting this operative, defence dice results of 5+ are critical successes [56].

strategy_ploys.name: CLOUD OF FLIES
strategy_ploys.description: A swarming cloud of flies protects Plague Marines [57].
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever an operative is shooting a friendly PLAGUE MARINE operative, if that friendly operative is wholly within 1" of a terrain feature that provides Cover, that friendly operative is obscured [57].

firefight_ploys.name: POISONOUS DEMISE
firefight_ploys.description: Upon death, a Plague Marine's body bursts with Nurgle's blessings [52].
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PLAGUE MARINE operative is incapacitated, before it’s removed from the killzone. Inflict D3 damage on each enemy operative within 3" of it (roll separately for each). If the D3 result is a 3, each of those enemy operatives also gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one) [52].

rules.name: POISON
rules.description: Nurgle deals in warp-tainted poisons, toxins, viral plagues and sicknesses of the soul that defy both natural resilience and medical intervention. Some weapons in this team’s rules have the Poison weapon rule [48].
rules.rules:
*Poison: In the Resolve Attack Dice step, if you inflict damage with any successes, the operative this weapon is being used against (excluding friendly PLAGUE MARINE operatives) gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). Whenever an operative that has one of your Poison tokens is activated, inflict 1 damage on it [48, 54].
*Toxic: Whenever this operative is using this weapon against an enemy operative that has one of your Poison tokens, add 1 to both Dmg stats of this weapon [50, 56].

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: Space Marines are genetically augmented transhumans forged for only one purpose: war [58].
rules.rules: During each friendly PLAGUE MARINE operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them. You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation [57, 58].

name: RATLINGS
description: This kill team has numerous synergies that make it much greater than the sum of its smaller parts. For example, a sniper rifle is fearsome enough, but giving it Lethal 5+ from the Fixer, Seek Light from the Spotter (while ignoring obscured), and re-rolls from ammo caches is a deadly combo. Once you line all these up, your opponent will be wary of allowing their operatives to be a valid target. Because of this, it can be tempting to set up a defensive gun line to shoot your [59].

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 RATLING FIXER operative with one of the following options:
 * Battle rifle; fists
 * Sniper rifle; fists
↘ 10 RATLING operatives selected from the following list:
 * BATTLEMUTT
 * BULLGRYN with one option from each of the following:
   ○ Grenadier gauntlet or power maul
   ○ Brute shield or slabshield
 * OGRYN
 * BIG SHOT
 * BOMBER
 * HARDBIT
 * RAIDER
 * SNEAK
 * SNIPER
 * SPOTTER
 * STASHMASTER
 * VOX-THIEF
Other than BULLGRYN, OGRYN and SNIPER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. You cannot select more than three of these operatives combined. Up to three times, instead of selecting one of these operatives, you can select one RATLING ploy to cost you 0CP for the battle [60-62].

operatives.name: RATLING FIXER
operatives.description: Ratling Fixers are key operatives in a Ratling kill team [61]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, LEADER, FIXER

operatives.name: RATLING BATTLEMUTT
operatives.description: Battlemutts are animal companions in a Ratling kill team [63].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, BATTLEMUTT

abilities.name: Beast
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight and Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard [63].

abilities.name: Bayonet Charge
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative finishes moving during the Charge action, you can inflict D3+1 damage on one enemy operative within its control range [63].

operatives.name: BULLGRYN
operatives.description: Particularly obstinate and resilient Ogryns are selected to serve as Bullgryns. They are outfitted with thick armour, heavy shields and brutal melee weapons, enabling them to bludgeon their foes to death in the thick of combat [64].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, BULLGRYN

abilities.name: Slow-witted
abilities.rules: You must spend 1 additional AP for this operative to perform the Pick Up Marker and mission actions (excluding Operate Hatch) [65].

operatives.name: OGRYN
operatives.description: Burly abhumans originating from high-gravity planets, Ogryns are occasionally fielded alongside Ratlings. These hulking soldiers view Ratlings as their ‘little mates’, and are extremely protective of them [64].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, OGRYN

operatives.name: BIG SHOT
operatives.description: Big Shots are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, BIG SHOT

operatives.name: RATLING BOMBER
operatives.description: Bombers are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, BOMBER

weapons.name: EXPLOSIVE ARSENAL
weapons.rules: Range 3", Blast 1", Heavy (Reposition only), Limited 1, Piercing 1, Saturate

abilities.name: Tripwire
abilities.rules: When setting up equipment before the battle, you can set up to two of your Tripwire markers up wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points and Accessible terrain [66].

operatives.name: HARDBIT
operatives.description: Hardbits are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, HARDBIT

operatives.name: RAIDER
operatives.description: Raiders are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, RAIDER

operatives.name: SNEAK
operatives.description: Sneaks are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, SNEAK

operatives.name: SNIPER
operatives.description: Snipers are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, SNIPER

operatives.name: SPOTTER
operatives.description: Spotters possess great focus, accurately guiding salvoes of mortar fire from safe lines even when under immense pressure. With this they can stymie enemy attacks or pin them down in their defences [67]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts specific to Ratlings [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, SPOTTER

operatives.name: STASHMASTER
operatives.description: Stashmasters are operatives in a Ratling kill team [60]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, STASHMASTER

operatives.name: VOX-THIEF
operatives.description: Vox-thieves utilise listening devices to intercept enemy communications. These devices also function as midrange vox-casters [64]. Note: Specific stats, weapons, abilities, and actions for this operative are not detailed in the provided source excerpts [60, 61].
operatives.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, VOX-THIEF

equipment.name: DYNAMITE
equipment.description: Dynamite is an explosive device [68].
equipment.rules:
Once per turning point, a friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT) can use the following ranged weapon:
NAME ATK HIT DMG WR Dynamite 5 4+ 4/5 Range 4", Blast 1", Heavy (Reposition only), Saturate [68].

equipment.name: HARPOON
equipment.description: This weapon fires a sharp, barbed projectile that snags any foes it doesn’t kill outright, preventing them from moving [68].
equipment.rules:
Once per turning point, a friendly KOMMANDO operative (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT) can use the following ranged weapon:
NAME ATK HIT DMG WR Harpoon 4 4+ 4/5 Range 8", Lethal 5+, Stun [68].

rules.name: THROAT SLITTAS
rules.description: Unusual amongst Orks, Kommandos utilise stealth and misdirection to close in before falling upon the enemy with jagged blades drawn [69].
rules.rules: Friendly KOMMANDO operatives can move within control range of enemy operatives (they must still start and end the move following all requirements for that move) [69].

rules.name: TANKED UP
rules.description: The obsession with destruction gives Wreckas a renewed drive [70].
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW operative (excluding BOMB SQUIGS) performs the Shoot or Fight action, you add 1 to their APL stat until the start of their next activation [70].

name: SANCTIFIERS
description: Sanctifier kill teams are fervent warriors of the Adeptus Ministorum, devoted to the Imperial Creed. They are chosen to rigorously enforce their Order's precepts, inspiring their comrades with zeal and unwavering faith in the heart of battle. These teams include various specialists, from enforcers and combat medics to those who harness holy power and sacrifice for the greater good of their faith.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 SANCTIFIER CONFESSOR operative
↘ 1 SANCTIFIER CHERUB operative
↘ 9 SANCTIFIER operatives selected from the following list:
* CONFLAGRATOR
* DEATH CULT ASSASSIN
* DRILL ABBOT
* MIRACULIST
* MISSIONARY with one of the following options:
  ○ Ministorum flamer; brazier of holy fire
  ○ Ministorum flamer; gun butt; holy relic
* MISSIONARY with one of the following options:
  ○ Meltagun; chainsword; holy relic
  ○ Plasma gun; chainsword; brazier of holy fire
* PERSECUTOR
* PREACHER
* RELIQUANT
* SALVATIONIST
Other than PREACHER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative above once. Your kill team can only include up to four PREACHER operatives.
You cannot select an option that includes a brazier of holy fire more than once per battle. [3, 4]

operatives.name: CONFESSOR
operatives.description: The Confessor leads their Kill Team into battle, inspiring their sisters to unleash brutal displays of zeal upon the enemies of the Imperium.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, LEADER, CONFESSOR

weapons.name: TWIN HAND FLAMERS
weapons.rules: Range 6", Saturate, Torrent 2", Blaze*, Twin Torrent¹*

abilities.name: Twin Torrent¹
abilities.rules: Select up to two valid targets. Shoot with this weapon against both of them in an order of your choice (roll each sequence separately). Torrent 0" means you cannot select secondary targets, but this weapon still has the Torrent weapon rule for all other rules purposes, e.g. the Condensed Stronghold rule (see Killzone: Volkus, Kill Team Core Book). [5]

actions.name: Lead the Procession
actions.rules: In each turning point after the first, whenever this operative is an ORATOR and performs the Charge, Fall Back or Reposition action during its activation, you can use this rule before it moves. If you do, determine each other friendly SANCTIFIER operative that’s benefitting from the SERMON. After this operative ends that action, each of those friendly SANCTIFIER operatives can immediately perform a free Charge, Fall Back or Reposition action in an order of your choice (choose separately for each), but each must end that move in a location where they are still benefitting from the SERMON. If this operative is incapacitated before this rule is fully resolved, e.g. from the Guard action’s interruption (see close quarters rules, Kill Team Core Book), don’t remove it from the killzone until this rule has been resolved. [6, 7]

operatives.name: CHERUB
operatives.description: Cherubs are servile familiars that assist their masters in battle. [8]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, CHERUB [8]

abilities.name: Restricted Actions
abilities.rules: This operative cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard, or perform unique actions other than Incentivise. [8]

actions.name: INCENTIVISE
actions.rules: SUPPORT. Select one other friendly SANCTIFIER operative (excluding CONFESSOR, DEATH CULT ASSASSIN, MIRACULIST and ORATOR) visible to and within 2" of this operative. Until the end of that operative’s next activation, add 1 to its APL stat. [6]
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative. [6]

operatives.name: DEATH CULT ASSASSIN
operatives.description: For a Death Cult Executioner, the act of living is a blasphemy only balanced by the tally of souls they reap. They deliver death up close and master numerous combat styles. [9] (Note: description refers to Elucidian Starstriders' Death Cult Executioner, as no specific description was given for Sanctifier's Death Cult Assassin. Synthesized for context.)
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, DEATH CULT ASSASSIN [10]

abilities.name: Bladed Stance
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is fighting or retaliating, you can resolve one of your successes before the normal order. If you do, that success must be used to block. [8]

actions.name: TRAINED ASSASSIN
actions.rules: Change this operative’s order. [10]
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative. [10]

operatives.name: PERSECUTOR
operatives.description: Persecutors are fervent close-combat specialists, wielding powerful melee weapons and flamers to purge the Emperor's foes.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, PERSECUTOR [5]

abilities.name: Merciless Castigation
abilities.rules: The first time this operative performs the Fight action during each of its activations, if neither it nor the enemy operative in that sequence is incapacitated, this operative can immediately perform a free Fight action afterwards, but you cannot select any other enemy operative to fight against during that action (and only if it’s still valid to fight against). This takes precedence over action restrictions. [10]

abilities.name: Fanatical Retribution
abilities.rules: If this operative is incapacitated during the Fight action, you can strike the enemy operative in that sequence with one of your unresolved successes before this operative is removed from the killzone. [5]

operatives.name: MISSIONARY
operatives.description: Missionaries are veteran combatants who have operated independently across the galaxy, bringing the Imperial Creed to distant worlds and fighting heresies wherever they arise. [11]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, MISSIONARY [12]

abilities.name: Cult Icon
abilities.rules: Whenever determining control of a marker within 6" of this operative, treat the total APL stat of friendly SANCTIFIER operatives that contest it as 1 higher if at least one friendly SANCTIFIER operative contests that marker. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. [12]

operatives.name: PREACHER
operatives.description: Preachers exhort their comrades with fiery rhetoric, inspiring them to greater acts of devotion and defence.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, PREACHER [13]

abilities.name: Defend the Faith
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative contests an objective marker, it’s benefitting from the SERMON. [13]

operatives.name: PURGATUS
operatives.description: Purgatus operatives are specialists in close-range purification, wielding heavy flamers to cleanse foes and obstacles alike.
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTA SORORITAS, PURGATUS [14]

abilities.name: Purge with Flame
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, you can use the Inferno firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified friendly NOVITIATE operative. [14]

operatives.name: RELIQUARIUS
operatives.description: Reliquarius operatives bear holy relics, inspiring faith and courage in their comrades. [15]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTA SORORITAS, RELIQUARIUS [15]

operatives.name: PRECEPTOR
operatives.description: Novitiate Preceptors ensure their Order’s precepts are rigidly enforced and serve as exemplars in combat. [16]
operatives.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTA SORORITAS, PRECEPTOR [17]

abilities.name: Unflinching Example
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative incapacitates a ready enemy operative within its control range, you gain 1 Faith point, or 2 Faith points if that enemy operative had a Wounds stat of 12 or more. [18]

abilities.name: Glorious Hymnal
abilities.rules: SUPPORT. Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE operative is within 3" of this operative, that friendly operative’s weapons have the Severe weapon rule. [18]

firefight_ploys.name: UNWAVERING DEVOTION
firefight_ploys.description: Sanctifiers fight with unwavering resolve, their faith shielding them from harm.
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is shooting, fighting or retaliating, after you roll your attack dice. If it’s the Shoot action, that other operative is only in cover or obscured if the original target was. [7]

firefight_ploys.name: GLORIOUS MARTYRDOM
firefight_ploys.description: Upon being incapacitated, a Sanctifier’s final moments can ignite a furious counter-attack from their comrades. [19]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NOVITIATE operative is incapacitated, before it’s removed from the killzone. [19]

equipment.name: PURITY SEALS
equipment.description: Affixed to clothing, armour and wargear by way of wax seals, these pieces of parchment are inscribed with holy prayers and blessings. [20]
equipment.rules: Once per turning point, when a friendly SANCTIFIER operative is shooting or fighting, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a normal success instead. [20]

rules.name: SERMON
rules.description: The spiritual guidance of key operatives grants benefits to nearby allies. [6, 13]
rules.rules: Referenced by operative abilities. Not explicitly detailed as a standalone faction rule in provided sources.

rules.name: UNWAVERING FAITH
rules.description: Sanctifiers remain steadfast even when injured. [10]
rules.rules: You can ignore any changes to the Move stat of friendly NOVITIATE operatives from being injured. [21]

name: SCOUT SQUAD
description: Scout Squads are elite Space Marine initiates tasked with ranging ahead of their Chapters' main forces. They specialise in reconnaissance, laying traps, harassing enemy patrols, and gathering intelligence, all in preparation for the Chapter's larger assault. These highly trained warriors combine stealth and combat prowess to achieve their objectives in hazardous environments.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 SCOUT SQUAD SERGEANT operative with one of the following options:
* Astartes shotgun; fists
* Boltgun; fists
* Bolt pistol; chainsword
↘ 8 SCOUT SQUAD operatives selected from the following list:
* HEAVY GUNNER with fists, bolt pistol and heavy bolter
* HEAVY GUNNER with fists, bolt pistol and missile launcher
* HUNTER
* SNIPER
* TRACKER
* WARRIOR with one of the following options:
  ○ Astartes shotgun; fists
  ○ Boltgun; fists
  ○ Bolt pistol; combat blade
Other than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [22]

operatives.name: SERGEANT
operatives.description: The Sergeant is an experienced leader, guiding their Scout Squad in the field. [23]
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, LEADER, SERGEANT [23]

abilities.name: Grapnel Launcher
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the operative actually moves vertically). [23]

operatives.name: TRACKER
operatives.description: Trackers carry highly powerful auspexes – scanners capable of analysing the battlefield, identifying targets or rapidly planning deadly ambushes. [24]
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, TRACKER [25]

operatives.name: WARRIOR
operatives.description: Scout Warriors are skilled fighters, committed to their squad and determined to ascend to full battle-brother status. [24]
operatives.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, WARRIOR [26]

abilities.name: Adaptive Equipment
abilities.rules:
You can do each of the following once per turning point:
* One friendly SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR operative can perform the Smoke Grenade action.
* One friendly SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR operative can perform the Stun Grenade action.
The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule doesn’t count towards their action limits (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment). [25, 26]

firefight_ploys.name: EMBOLDENED ASPIRANT
firefight_ploys.description: Scout Squads are emboldened by the prospect of proving themselves in battle.
firefight_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative is fighting or retaliating, if it has a higher Wounds stat than that friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative, you can change one of your retained normal successes to a critical success instead. Any rules that take effect as a result of retaining a critical success (e.g. Devastating, Piercing Crits, etc.) still do. [27]

firefight_ploys.name: COVERT POSITION
firefight_ploys.description: Scouts use their superior stealth training to remain hidden from enemy sight.
firefight_ploys.rules: Until the start of its next activation, while that operative has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2". [28]

equipment.name: COMBAT BLADE
equipment.description: These simple but effective blades are carried by Scout Squad operatives for close-quarters engagements.
equipment.rules:
Friendly SCOUT SQUAD operatives have the following melee weapon. Note that some operatives already have this weapon but with better stats; in that instance, use the better version.
NAME ATK HIT DMG Combat blade 3 3+ 4/5
Friendly SCOUT SQUAD HUNTER and SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR operatives that already have a combat blade (but with different stats) have the following melee weapon instead:
NAME ATK HIT DMG Combat knife 4 3+ 4/5 [29]

rules.name: ASTARTES
rules.description: Space Marines are genetically modified superhumans made for one purpose: war. [23]
rules.rules: During each friendly SCOUT SQUAD operative’s activation, it can perform either two Shoot actions or two Fight actions. If it’s two Shoot actions, an Astartes shotgun, bolt pistol or boltgun must be selected for at least one of them. This operative can counteract regardless of its order. [23]

rules.name: FORWARD SCOUTING
rules.description: Central to the role of Space Marine Scouts is ranging ahead of the strike force they are attached to, spending extensive periods laying traps for the foe, harassing enemy patrols, gathering intelligence and reconnoitring the ground in preparation for the Chapter’s assault force. [30]
rules.rules:
At the end of the Set Up Operatives step, you can select and resolve up to six Forward Scouting options.
Redeploy (1) Change the set up of one third of your operatives (rounding up).
Reposition (2) Perform a free Reposition action with one friendly operative that’s wholly within your drop zone. It must end that move wholly within 3" of your drop zone. [26, 28]

name: TEMPESTUS AQUILONS
description: Tempestus Aquilons are an elite tactical shooting kill team of the Imperium, renowned for their unparalleled ability to descend into the killzone mid-battle. Composed of highly disciplined specialists, they excel at rapid engagements, providing precise fire support and seizing objectives with shock and awe tactics.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 TEMPESTUS AQUILON TEMPESTOR operative with one of the following options:
* Hot‑shot laspistol; power weapon
* Relic bolt pistol; chainsword
* Hot‑shot lascarbine; fists
↘ 1 TEMPESTUS AQUILON SERVO‑SENTRY with one of the following options:
* Flamer
* Grenade launcher
* Hot‑shot volley gun
↘ 9 TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives selected from the following list:
* GRENADIER
* GUNFIGHTER
* GUNNER with melta carbine and fists
* GUNNER with plasma carbine and fists
* MARKSMAN
* PRECURSOR
* TROOPER
Other than TROOPER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [31, 32]

operatives.name: TEMPESTOR
operatives.description: A Tempestor leads their kill team into the thick of battle, possessing the tactical and strategic nous to direct their squad’s efforts. [33]
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, TEMPESTOR, LEADER [31]

abilities.name: Salvo*
abilities.rules: Select up to two valid targets. Shoot with this weapon against both of them in an order of your choice (roll each sequence separately). [34]

abilities.name: Gunfight
abilities.rules: Whenever an enemy operative within 8" of this operative shoots this operative, keep track of each attack dice that’s discarded as a fail. After the action, before incapacitated operatives are removed (including this one, if relevant), this operative can perform a free Shoot action (you can change its order to Engage to do so), but it can only target that enemy operative with its hot‑shot laspistols (focused), and you only roll a number of attack dice equal to the opponent’s discarded attack dice plus one (to a maximum of four). [34]

operatives.name: GRENADIER
operatives.description: Aquilon Grenadiers specialise in the expert deployment of explosive ordinances.
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, GRENADIER [35]

abilities.name: Grenadier
abilities.rules: This operative can use frag, krak, smoke and stun grenades (see universal equipment). Doing so doesn’t count towards any limited uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other operatives). Whenever this operative is using a frag or krak grenade, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1. [35]

operatives.name: MARKSMAN
operatives.description: Aquilon Marksmen are expert snipers, providing precision fire support from advantageous positions. [36]
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, MARKSMAN [37]

abilities.name: Concealed Position*
abilities.rules: This operative can only use this weapon the first time it’s performing the Shoot action during the battle. [35]

operatives.name: SERVO‑SENTRY
operatives.description: A servo‑sentry is a combat mechanoid that drops via grav‑impeller motors and provides Aquilon kill teams with fire support. [38]
operatives.keywords: AQUILON, SERVO‑SENTRY, IMPERIUM [39]

abilities.name: Machine
abilities.rules: This operative cannot be activated or perform actions if it’s within control range of an enemy operative, or if a friendly IMPERIAL NAVY BREACHER SURVEYOR operative has been incapacitated. The turning point can end even if this operative is still ready. This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Reposition and Spot. It cannot retaliate, assist in a fight, climb or jump. [39]

abilities.name: Turret
abilities.rules: This operative can perform two Shoot actions during its activation. [39]

operatives.name: GUNNER
operatives.description: Aquilon Gunners wield powerful melta and plasma carbines to bring down elite foes and armoured targets. [33]
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, GUNNER [39]

operatives.name: PRECURSOR
operatives.description: Precursors are agile close-combat operatives, punishing complacent enemies with their swift and brutal attacks. [36]
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, PRECURSOR [40]

abilities.name: Vicious Knife Fighter
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is fighting, after resolving your first attack dice during that sequence, you can immediately resolve another (before your opponent). [40]

abilities.name: Dynamic
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative performs the Shoot or Fight action, it can immediately perform a free Dash action afterwards. It can do so even if it’s performed the Charge action during this activation, but can only use any remaining move distance it had from that Charge action (to a maximum of 3"). [40]

operatives.name: TROOPER
operatives.description: Tempestus Aquilon Troopers are rigorously trained warriors, clad in resilient carapace armour and wielding powerful hot-shot lascarbines. [38]
operatives.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, TROOPER [41]

strategy_ploys.name: SUDDEN OFFENSIVE
strategy_ploys.description: Tempestus Aquilons are skilled at dropping swiftly into combat and catching their enemies unawares. [42]
strategy_ploys.rules: Count the number of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives that aren’t incapacitated, then halve the result (rounding up) to give you x. Until the end of their activation, friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives’ weapons have the Balanced weapon rule if they are the first friendly operatives activated this turning point equal to x. For example, if you have five operatives, the first three friendly operatives activated will benefit. [42]

strategy_ploys.name: EYE ABOVE
strategy_ploys.description: Airborne servo‑skulls and spotter aircraft keep the Aquilons appraised of up‑to‑the‑minute tactical data. [43]
strategy_ploys.rules: Not detailed in provided sources.

strategy_ploys.name: DROP AND SECURE
strategy_ploys.description: Priority tactical objectives must be secured to ensure victory is absolute. [44]
strategy_ploys.rules:
Select one marker.
* Until the Ready step of the next turning point, when determining control of that marker, treat the total APL stat of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operatives that contest it as 1 higher if at least one friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative contests that marker. Note this isn’t a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
* Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative is within 3" of that marker, add 1 to the Atk stat of its melee weapons (to a maximum of 4). [44, 45]

strategy_ploys.name: MAINTAIN MOMENTUM
strategy_ploys.description: Aquilons maintain their aggressive posture, pressing the attack against any ready foe.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative is shooting against or fighting against a ready enemy operative, that friendly operative’s weapons have the Severe weapon rule. [45]

firefight_ploys.name: ADJUST COORDINATES
firefight_ploys.description: As the firefight flows and develops, so those Aquilons still descending adjust their trajectories in response. [43]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative lands. You can set it up within 5" horizontally of one of your Drop markers, taking precedence over the normal distance requirement. It cannot perform the Dash, Shoot or Fight actions during this turning point. [43]

firefight_ploys.name: HOT DROP
firefight_ploys.description: Aquilons land with blistering speed, delivering a devastating initial strike. [46]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy after rolling your attack dice for a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative that either landed or dropped from Vantage terrain at least 2" higher than the killzone floor during this activation. [45, 47]

equipment.name: DROP AUGURY
equipment.description: This item provides intelligence from orbiting warships, allowing Aquilons to adjust their landing zones. [48]
equipment.rules: Once per battle, when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON operative that’s set up above is activated, before expending or landing that operative, you can move one of your Drop markers again. However, it cannot be moved closer to your opponent’s drop zone. [48]

rules.name: DROP INSERTION
rules.description: Tempestus Aquilons have an unparalleled ability to descend into the killzone mid-battle. [49]
rules.rules:
When setting up a TEMPESTUS AQUILON kill team before the battle, the first third of your kill team must be set up as normal. Each third thereafter can be set up above: place them to one side instead of in the killzone. For each third that’s set up above, you must set up the whole third in this way (not some of them), then place one of your Drop markers wholly within your drop zone.
Less than half of your operatives can be set up above by the end of the first turning point. In other words, by the end of the first turning point, more than half of your operatives must have been set up in the killzone during the battle.
When readying your operatives during the second and third turning points, remove one of your Drop markers. This means operatives still set up above are incapacitated at the end of the second turning point. [41, 50]

name: VESPID STINGWINGS
description: Vespid Stingwings are an offensive kill team of highly agile xenos, characterised by their swarm-like instinctual behaviours. Guided by their Strain Leader and T'au handlers, they leverage advanced neutron weaponry and incredible flight capabilities to overwhelm enemies with devastating point-blank energy blasts and vicious melee attacks. [51, 52]

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 VESPID STINGWING STRAIN LEADER operative
↘ 1 VESPID STINGWING OVERSIGHT DRONE operative
↘ 9 VESPID STINGWING operatives selected from the following list:
* LONGSTING
* SHADESTRAIN
* SKYBLAST
* SWARMGUARD
* WARRIOR
Other than WARRIOR operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. [53]

operatives.name: STRAIN LEADER
operatives.description: It is the task of the Strain Leader to interpret the commands of their kill team’s handler and then ensure their operatives comply. [54]
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, STRAIN, LEADER [55]

abilities.name: Communion Helm
abilities.rules: Once during each of this operative’s activations, you can spend 1 Communion point for free. [55]

abilities.name: Commune
abilities.rules: When selecting your operatives for the battle, also select one VESPID STINGWING strategy ploy. Whenever this operative is in the killzone and isn’t within control range of enemy operatives, that ploy costs you 0CP. [55]

operatives.name: OVERSIGHT DRONE
operatives.description: The MV44 Oversight Drone is an adaptation of aerial reconnaissance units, providing invaluable tactical intelligence. [54]
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, OVERSIGHT, DRONE [56]

abilities.name: Drone
abilities.rules: This operative cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Dash, Fall Back, Fight, Reposition. It cannot use any weapons that aren’t on its datacard. Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this operative’s APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn’t a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. Whenever determining what’s visible to this operative, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head. [57, 58]

operatives.name: LONGSTING
operatives.description: Vespid Longstings wield potent neutron rail rifles, capable of atom-stripping energy charges.
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, LONGSTING [55]

weapons.name: NEUTRON RAIL RIFLE (AIMED)
weapons.rules: Devastating 2, Heavy (Dash only), Lethal 5+, Neutron Fragment*

abilities.name: Neutron Fragment*
abilities.rules: If the target of this weapon isn’t incapacitated but you resolve any attack dice, the target gains one of your Neutron Fragment tokens. Whenever an operative that has one of your Neutron Fragment tokens is activated, inflict D3 damage on it for each Neutron Fragment token it has (roll separately for each). [56, 59]

operatives.name: SHADESTRAIN
operatives.description: Vespid Shadestrains are masters of flame, capable of unleashing torrents of fire to incinerate their foes. [60]
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, SHADESTRAIN [61]

abilities.name: Skytorch*
abilities.rules: An operative can only use this weapon during the Skytorch Assault action (see other side of card). If it does, don’t select a valid target. Instead, shoot against each operative within its torch zone (excluding operatives wholly underneath Vantage terrain); they aren’t in cover or obscured. Roll each sequence separately in order of furthest operative to closest. The torch zone is the horizontal area between the operative’s current and previous location. A 28mm round Skytorch marker can be temporarily placed underneath this operative before it moves to help determine this. Torrent 0" means you cannot select secondary targets outside of its torch zone, but this weapon still has the Torrent weapon rule for all other rules purposes, e.g. the Condensed Stronghold rule (see Killzone: Volkus, Kill Team Core Book). [61, 62]

operatives.name: SWARMGUARD
operatives.description: Vespid Swarmguards provide focused neutron blaster fire, adapting to battlefield conditions with their instincts. [53]
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, SWARMGUARD [63]

abilities.name: Warrior Instincts
abilities.rules: Whenever this operative is shooting, if you don’t spend Communion points during that sequence, its neutron blaster has the Accurate 1 weapon rule until the end of that sequence. [63]

operatives.name: WARRIOR
operatives.description: The bulk of most Mal’kor kill teams is comprised of Warriors. Resilient, swift and strong, they are natural combatants. [60]
operatives.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T’AU EMPIRE, WARRIOR [63]

strategy_ploys.name: HARDENED EXOSKELETON
strategy_ploys.description: Natural exoskeletal chitin armours the Vespids, giving them an insectile resilience against all but the most grievous blows. [64]
strategy_ploys.rules: Not detailed in provided sources.

strategy_ploys.name: STING
strategy_ploys.description: The bayonet‑like stingers that jut from the Vespids’ abdomens can be employed as weapons, their vicious barbs piercing plate armour and driving deep into their victims’ bodies. [65]
strategy_ploys.rules: Improve the Hit stat of friendly VESPID STINGWING operatives’ claws by 1, and those weapons have the Lethal 5+ and Shock weapon rules. [65, 66]

strategy_ploys.name: AIRBORNE PREDATORS
strategy_ploys.description: Vespids strike from above with enhanced accuracy. [65]
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative moves or uses FLY during its activation, its weapons have the Balanced weapon rule until the end of that activation. [65, 67]

firefight_ploys.name: OCELLI
firefight_ploys.description: The multispectral eyesight and esoteric sensory acuity of the Vespids are equal to any scanning technologies. [68]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative performs the Shoot action during an activation in which it’s used FLY. Until the end of that action, it gains all benefits from the first and second main features of Vantage terrain. When determining the height difference between operatives for Vantage terrain rules, treat that friendly operative as being 3" higher than it currently is (but not when determining the distance for Communion). [67, 68]

firefight_ploys.name: NEUTRON OVERLOAD
firefight_ploys.description: Augmented by rapid wing beats, Vespid neutron weaponry can unleash horrific point‑blank energy blasts. [69]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when you resolve a critical success for a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative that’s shooting with a neutron weapon during an activation in which it’s moved or used FLY. If the target is within 4" of it, inflict D3 additional damage. [69]

firefight_ploys.name: VICIOUS VENOM
firefight_ploys.description: Many Strains of Vespid produce various neurotoxins and inflammatory agents from their abdominal stingers. [70]
firefight_ploys.rules: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative (excluding OVERSIGHT DRONE) is fighting and you strike with a critical success. Inflict D3 additional damage. [70]

equipment.name: ACCELERANT STIMULANT
equipment.description: Though it bears long‑term risks of injury or dangerous fatigue, this stimulant sharpens the Vespids’ reactions and lends them haste in the heat of battle. [71]
equipment.rules: Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative (excluding OVERSIGHT DRONE) performs the Charge or Dash action, it can move an additional 1". If it uses FLY for this action, you can set it back up 1" further away. [71]

equipment.name: AGGRESSION STIMULANT
equipment.description: A highly‑addictive mixture of combat stimulants and aggression amplifiers. [71]
equipment.rules: Not detailed in provided sources.

rules.name: NEUTRON CHARGE
rules.description: Neutron weapons are powered by radioactive crystals from the Vespids’ home world. [72]
rules.rules: Neutron weapons are any weapons that have the word ‘neutron’ in their name, e.g. neutron blaster, neutron grenade launcher, etc. Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative moves or uses FLY, its neutron weapons have the Piercing 1 weapon rule until the end of the turning point. [67, 72]

rules.name: COMMUNION
rules.description: Communion points are used to maintain the tactical focus of friendly VESPID STINGWING operatives. [73]
rules.rules:
Communion points are used to maintain the tactical focus of friendly VESPID STINGWING operatives. In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, you gain D3 Communion points, plus 1 if a friendly OVERSIGHT DRONE operative is in the killzone. Communion points are used as follows (OVERSIGHT DRONE operatives aren’t affected by the following):
1. Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative is performing the Shoot action, it can only target the closest enemy operative within 8" of it (excluding enemy operatives within control range of other friendly VESPID STINGWING operatives) unless you spend 1 of your Communion points. For weapons with the Blast and Torrent weapon rules, only the first target must be selected in this way.
2. Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative is fighting, it can only target the closest enemy operative unless you spend 1 of your Communion points.
3. Whenever you would perform the Pick Up Marker or a mission action (excluding Operate Hatch) with a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative, you must spend 1 of your Communion points. [64, 73, 74]

rules.name: FLY
rules.description: The thrumming wings of the Vespids bear them aloft with speed and remarkable agility. [75]
rules.rules: Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING operative performs an action in which it moves, it can FLY. If it does, don’t move it. Instead, remove it from the killzone and set it back up wholly within a distance equal to its Move stat (or 3" if it was a Dash) horizontally of its original location (in a killzone that uses the close quarters rules, e.g. Killzone: Gallowdark, this distance cannot be measured over or through Wall terrain, and that operative cannot be set up on the other side of an access point – in other words it cannot FLY through an open hatchway). Note that it gains no additional distance when performing the Charge action. It must be set up in a location it can be placed, and unless it’s the Charge action, it cannot be set up within control range of an enemy operative. [75]

name: VOID-DANCER TROUPE
description: Even amongst the agile Aeldari, the Harlequins of the Void-dancer Troupes display an almost preternatural level of dexterity and skill. Performance and war merge in their actions, precisely directed to shape the fate of their race.

selection.operatives:
↘ 1 VOID-DANCER TROUPE LEAD PLAYER operative with one option from each of the following: ○ Fusion pistol, neuro disruptor or shuriken pistol ○ Blade, caress, embrace, kiss or power weapon
↘ 7 VOID-DANCER TROUPE operatives selected from the following list:
• DEATH JESTER • PLAYER with one option from each of the following: ○ Fusion pistol, neuro disruptor or shuriken pistol ○ Blade, caress, embrace or kiss • SHADOWSEER with hallucinogen grenade and one of the following options:
○ Neuro disruptor; miststave ○ Shuriken pistol; miststave

Other than PLAYER operatives, your kill team can only include each operative on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to one fusion pistol and up to one neuro disruptor.

operatives.name: LEAD PLAYER
operatives.description: Choreographers of conflict, Lead Players are experienced Harlequins clad in extravagant garb. They direct their warriors’ reactions to the fates of battle and ensure their comrades’ performances in the theatre of war is as perfect as it can be.
operatives.keywords: VOID-DANCER TROUPE, AELDARI, HARLEQUIN, LEADER, LEAD PLAYER

abilities.name: Lead the Performance
abilities.rules: Once per battle STRATEGIC GAMBIT. If this operative is in the killzone, change the ALLEGORY you selected for your kill team. Note that the ACCOLADE rule friendly operatives have will also change.

operatives.name: DEATH JESTER
operatives.description: The arrival of a Death Jester in a killzone is announced by a hissing storm of shrieker cannon fire. Enemy infantry are torn apart as the weapon’s gene-toxins cause them to combust horrifically from within. Adding insult to injury, the Death Jester ensures every demise is cruelly ironic.
operatives.keywords: VOID-DANCER TROUPE, AELDARI, HARLEQUIN, DEATH JESTER

weapons.name: SHRIEKER CANNON (FOCUSED)
weapons.rules: Rending, Heavy (Reposition only), Humbling Cruelty<font color="#f55c29">*</font>

weapons.name: SHRIEKER CANNON (SWEEPING)
weapons.rules: Rending, Heavy (Dash only), Torrent 2", Humbling Cruelty<font color="#f55c29">*</font>

abilities.name: <font color="#f55c29">*</font>Humbling Cruelty
abilities.rules: If the target of this weapon isn’t incapacitated but any of your attack dice inflict damage, the target gains one of your Humbling Cruelty tokens (if it doesn’t already have one). Whenever an enemy operative has one of your Humbling Cruelty tokens, worsen the Hit stat of its weapons by 1 and subtract 2" from its Move stat. This isn’t cumulative with being injured. At the end of that enemy operative’s next activation, remove its Humbling Cruelty token.

operatives.name: PLAYER
operatives.description: Harlequin Players perform with breathtaking skill, whether their stage is a wraithbone-and-glass amphitheatre bathed in crystalline light or the firelit hell of the battlefield. They tumble, sprint and leap, with every trigger squeeze and blade slash bringing orchestrated death to the enemy.
operatives.keywords: VOID-DANCER TROUPE, AELDARI, HARLEQUIN, PLAYER

abilities.name: Luck of the Laughing God
abilities.rules: Once per turning point, you can use this rule. If you do, you can use a firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified VOID-DANCER TROUPE operative (including Command Re-roll if the attack or defence dice was rolled for this operative). You cannot select the same firefight ploy for this rule more than once per battle.

operatives.name: SHADOWSEER
operatives.description: Shadowseers can blind foes and drive them mad with their psychic powers. As they obscure their allies with illusions, they fire hallucinogenic grenades that cause disorientation or death. In close combat, Shadowseers’ miststaves scramble the perceptions of those they hit.
operatives.keywords: VOID-DANCER TROUPE, AELDARI, HARLEQUIN, PSYKER, SHADOWSEER

weapons.name: HALLUCINOGEN GRENADE
weapons.rules: Range 6", Blast 2", Lethal 5+, Seek, Silent, Stun

actions.name: FOG OF DREAMS
effects: PSYCHIC. Select one ready enemy operative visible to this operative and roll one D6. Until the end of the turning point, that enemy operative cannot be activated or perform actions until it's the last enemy operative to be activated, or until your opponent has activated a number of enemy operatives after this action equal to the result of the D6 (whichever comes first).
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

actions.name: MIRROR OF MINDS
effects: PSYCHIC. Select one enemy operative that’s a valid target for and within 8" of this operative. Both players roll five D6. Pair your dice with your opponent’s dice based on matching results. For each matching pair, inflict D3 damage on that enemy operative (to a maximum of 8). For example, if you rolled 6, 5, 5, 2, 1 and your opponent rolled 6, 5, 4, 3, 1, you would inflict 3D3 damage on that enemy operative.
conditions: This operative cannot perform this action while within control range of an enemy operative.

strategy_ploys.name: DARTING SALVO
strategy_ploys.description: Advancing in a dazzling blurr of vibrant colour, Harlequins fire on the move, leaping away before their opponents can return fire.
strategy_ploys.rules: Whenever a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE operative performs the Reposition action during its activation, it can perform the Shoot action during that action (it must do so in a location it can be placed, and any remaining move distance it had from that Reposition action can be used after it does so).

strategy_ploys.name: RISING CRESCENDO
strategy_ploys.description: With each darting advance and lethal flourish, the tempo of the troupe’s performance increases, building towards a violent crescendo.
strategy_ploys.rules: Friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE operatives can perform the Dash action during the same activation in which they performed the Charge action, but not vice versa (i.e. not Dash then Charge).

strategy_ploys.name: PRISMATIC BLUR
strategy_ploys.description: So swift and dazzling are the Harlequins that even veteran marksmen struggle to draw a bead upon their lithe forms.
